Reviews.Title: “Glad we choose this hotel”
Reviews.Author: TesyaJakarta
Reviews.Content: After reading negative reviews on TA about this hotel, I still decided to stay at this hotel because of the hotel location, the pool and the Singapore Express bus from and too the zoo passes this hotel. Another reason was, I am travelling with my husband and kids of 3 and 5 yo, and this is one of the few hotels in booking.com who stated "all children under 12 are free" I didn't want to pay extra bed for our kids. It cost SGD 20 (incl tips) from the airport to this hotel. When we entered the hotel, yes there was an aromatherapy smell, which we get used to it on the next day. I asked to get the highest floor for our superrior room, and the hotel staff gave us room number 1128. The room has just been re-painted, which made it look fresh. There are stained on the carpets, but not too many. The furniture looks so 80's but the LCD tv and also HBO, kids channel, made up the tired look of the furniture. It also has a great view to the city. The room is spacious for the four of us. We paid 350 sgd (excl tax) for our 2 nights stay for our superior room, incl breakfast and free internet. The free wifi is amazingly fast. The bathroom was ok. And we get free newspaper every morning. Breakfast was at the Indian resto on the 5th floor, it was very basic, and the resto looks very old. We enjoyed the pool, it was a very clean pool. We didn't regret staying at this hotel at all, it is easy to access with bus and MRT. Bus stop "Victoria Street" are just outside the hotel with the tourist route such as: bus 133 to suntec, bus 145 to vivo city, bus 130 to little india, bus 175 from Lucky Plaza Orchard. From bus stop "North Bridge Complex" take bus 7 to Orchard. The SEX bus from and to the zoo stops at the hotel. It was very handy.

Reviews.Title: “A run down hotel”
Reviews.Author: spiritofindia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and it was a bad experience. Hotel has clearly seen better days and is in dire need of revamp. We stayed on 8th floor and room was very basic but the sad part was stained carpets. Wires coming out behind tables. Reception staff was ok and only saving grace was the luggage desk where the staff was really helpful. The location fine though with proximity to MRT. Important pointer that the pics on their website are not true reflection of actual hotel as the lobby, pool are much smaller.

Reviews.Title: “Way over priced for a very run down hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Ash_84nz
Reviews.Content: We were booked here in a standard room for 2 nights on our way to India for a longer holiday. We arrived at 8 am at the hotel well before the check-in time, staff was very accommodating and gave us a room straight away as we were travelling with an Infant. We got a 6 hour sleep in as we were knackered after a long haul flight from Auckland. When we finally got a bit charged up, we were horrified to see the condition of our standard room. Stains all over the carpets, curtains etc. Ripped wallpapers, all furniture severely scratched and very very run down in general. Reception informed us that is the general condition of all standard rooms and perhaps we be more comfortable in a club room at cost of extra $150 for 2 nights. The club room is exactly same room on a higher level with slightly less run-down furniture. On the 2nd night the toilet flush decided to get stuck and kept flushing non-stop. We complained to front desk that this needs to be fixed immediately as our infant daughter is fast asleep and it be chaos if she be woken from her deep sleep. After about 25 minute a maintenance person came up to check the situation who was warned to try not make too much noise. His staff walkie talkie kept going off constantly and he would constantly drop his tool bag etc on the bathroom floor. After much mucking for about 20min they finally got the flush semi-fixed as it would still get stuck on occasion. All this commotion finally woke our daughter up and she was very very cranky and would not sleep till 3am after crying for 3 hours straight. This is simply appalling for a supposedly 4 star hotel part of a reputable chain of hotels. The price of $250 per night we ended up paying after the upgrade is simply a rip off and way to expensive for level of amenities and general state of the rooms. Only positive thing was the included free breakfast at the hotels Indian restaurant which was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Landmark's Great Hospitality Service & Great Management!”
Reviews.Author: Doug S
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth visit to the Landmark Village Hotel (Victoria Rd.), and again they made my stay, as always absolutely great. The management (Andrew Tan) never ceases to amaze me, and they sure didn't disapoint me this time either. I arrived to Singapore after a 'nightmare' 12 hour flight delay coming from Beijing, and was very stressed out to say the least. When I arrived at the LM, there was no issues with my hotel reservation, as they were already aware on what was going on at the Beijing Airport. So after checking in I started to the elevator, and suddenly I heard this voice call my name, and it was the hotel manager (Andrew Tan), welcoming me back to his LM Hotel again. Bottom line, it does not get any better than someone caring & looking out for you, and I am not sure how many star's that is worth, but in my opion a lot.

Reviews.Title: “To be avoided”
Reviews.Author: TomYum
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute booking so we did not have much choice where to stay as our first choices were full due to a couple of conferences at the time. There was no time to do proper research on available hotels. Having stayed at Landmark in Bangkok, we (wrongly) assumed that it will be of the same ilk. Location – This was by far the only redeeming factor of staying at this hotel as also stated by previous reviewers. It is across the street from ‘Arab Street’ which was really fun visiting. Access to all major areas in the city is very easy whether by taxi or MRT. Reception – Physically tired looking. Staff was efficient on check-in. Room – As said in so many other reviews – this place is in SERIOUS need of renovation. What a nightmare! It is so tired looking and tacky it is scary. Our room was extremely noisy and we found it difficult to sleep. Part of the problem is the big gap between the door and the floor which means noise that is already amplified in the confined space of the hallway, comes flooding through. Bathrooms – The plumbing was so noisy, I thought people were drilling directly above us. Mildew was everywhere – especially between badly laid tiles. Furnishings – I doubt a secondhand store will look at buying this stuff. It really is in bad shape. The carpet was so badly stained; we were scared to walk around barefoot, because it just looks dirty! We decided to only return to the room after dark when things at least look less run-down. Service – What service?? Housekeeping knocks on the door despite a ‘Do not Disturb’ sign and then yells down the passage – ‘This room has a Do not Disturb’. Staff at reception could not even tell us whether to turn left or right in front of the hotel to get to Arab Street! I was waiting to check out with reception staff ‘faffing’ around instead of helping. The hotel manager happened to pass by and got them to help me. Meals – We had NO desire to even try. Considering the state of the rooms which are in the public eyes, I fear to think what the kitchens look like. Business Services – We did not make use of this. S$6 for 30 minutes of internet time. It is much better to pay that for a coffee at one of the many cafes and have unlimited internet. General – It has been a while since I paid good money for such a bad experience. I understand that Singapore is never cheap, but this was way too expensive for what is on offer. There is much better value available if you have the time to do proper research.

Reviews.Title: “great business lounge”
Reviews.Author: foody24
Reviews.Content: I have stayed several times already at this hotel and everytime I am welcomed like family. I always sign up for the business lounge facilities which means free access to the lounge and an evening cocktail between 6 & 8pm, free internet access and quiet breakfast in the lounge. Ms. Khine, who is responsible for the lounge is so helpful, friendly and professional! it may not be the top notch modern hi-tech hotel, it is a warm place where I feel welcome!

Reviews.Title: “3 day stay in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roy Z
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in last Oct when we attended ITB Asia held in Singapore. The location is very good, only about 10 minutes cab ride to Suntec where the convention was held, costing $6-8 per ride. The smell of the lobby is unpleasant to me.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate - no Just Adequate”
Reviews.Author: KSJ
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great spot - close to MRT & (for us) the all important Queen st bus depot. Singapore is NEVER cheap, but I hoped that by paying that 'little bit extra' I might get so something a 'little bit ....more(?)', my thoughts were that it was only one night, our flight landed at 22:10 & we needed to be in JB (Malaysia) by noon. The room is very spacious, the room service is closed at 23:00 & the mini bar snacks were just uninteresting. The hot water was hot & plentiful, the bathroom adequate, bed adequate, soundproofing between the rooms pretty poor but our neighbour was tired too and went to sleep at about 12:30. Breakfast was easily the most average buffet I've ever seen in Asia (& I travel a fair bit), a few helpful staff, the older lady in the restaurant & in particular Mr Hutchinson (security) - but all in all for a total of $355 sgd not in my opinion good value - either stay cheaper & feel you've used your money wisely or try the Fullerton or others - just so ....so so.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: ihazelynz
Reviews.Content: Love: ~ the location , the beautiful aromatheraphy smell throughout the hotel, the flat screen tv in the room, bathrobes, clean linens, helpful & friendly staff, plenty of halal restaurants nearby, textile (laces) shops across the street Not fond of : ~ the old iron marked carpet in the room, the way I was kept waiting for almost 45mins for my bags to arrive after checking in

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: arthur s
Reviews.Content: we stayed here 12-16th March. We booked a room on the executive floor and it was just fantastic. All the staff were so attentive & welcoming. It was very easy to get around the city from the hotel.Wouldn't hesitate to book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but Very Noisy and Poorly Maintained Rooms”
Reviews.Author: sinclairjacinto
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel from 05 Mar 2012 to 09 Mar 2012. While the location of the hotel is excellent with very close access to the Bugis MRT. However that is the only redeeming factor of the hotel The carpeting and other furniture in the rooms are ancient and worn out way beyond their use. Also the rooms are terribly noisy with constant disturbance from other rooms. It appears that the walls between rooms are made of cardboard and not concrete. The plumbing is also in bad shape so you can clearly hear each time the person in the next room has a shower. All in all stay at this hotel only if you cannot afford the other more upscale options avaiable in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Holqueen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 20 - 27 Feb and found the hotel to be more than satisfactory. Our room was on 14th floor with great views of the city. I think it was probably one of the refurbished rooms as there was a flat screen tv and modern bathroom. Other amenities were robes and slippers, tea and coffe making facilities, safe, minibar and complimentary water. There was certainly no smell of cigarettes and the room was kept very clean with bed linen change every day. The only complaint I would have about the room is the lighting - my husband found it very difficult to shave in the bathroom and for me putting on make up was a bit hit and miss. The breakfasts were okay - there is a choice of two restaurants for this. The dishes were the same every day. The staff can be a bit over zealous in clearing the tables which is not really a complaint but one time I had collected my food, put it on the table, went to get a spoon and when I returned it had gone! The pool area was very welcome after a day's sightseeing but as previous reviews have pointed out this area is often used in the evenings for weddings etc so, although no one actually says anything, you do feel that you should leave the area as no one wants someone wandering through their celebrations in their swimming costume! The hotel is very close to the MRT so getting around is a breeze. Also very close to Bugis Street market and food court. If I were to return to Singapore I would stay here again. Singapore hotels are generally expensive and I do think this one was reasonably priced for what you get. The staff were very friendly, especially Adam on reception.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry - the room smelt like an ashtray”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi8888
Reviews.Content: I had to stay here because the Park Royal down the road was packed.... like the title says the room smelt badly, amenities like soap and shampoo were of the worst quality, carpets were pretty old and tattered. I can't see any real redeeming features in this hotel other than the gym which was modern and clean. Maybe the closeness to some nice bars and restaurants. Pool was average and service was poor. The staff lacked a lot of knowledge of the surrounding area which was also pretty disappointing. I had to ask my friends to get any real local knowledge. Breakfast was really below par of a decent hotel - I am actually amazed about the positive reviews. Is there two Landmarks?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: loraine c
Reviews.Content: My second trip to Singapore and the last one was 30 years ago and this hotel was faultless. We had first been put into a room that we had problems with the airconditioner but the staff shifted us " up into the world", and the room was spacious, clean, and the view was breathtaking. The good thing about this hotel , that it is close to all amenities, such as MRT, food stalls and shopping. I could not fault the service and the food in the dining room was scrumptous . The staff were so courteous and a special thanks goes to Andrew Tan for making our stay worth while. We felt he couldn't do enough for us and I would like to regard him as a "friend" even if he called me "grandma"!

Reviews.Title: “My Singapore home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Scotlandia
Reviews.Content: I travel to Singapore regularly and always stay at the Landmark Village. It is well located and provides for all my needs economically and comfortably

Reviews.Title: “Good locality .... Not great rooms”
Reviews.Author: ravisethi2k
Reviews.Content: well the hotel is in a good locality right on arab street. I have come alone but they still gave me twin bed. room is decent size however washrooms are very small in size. Good place to stay if you are in Indian as Little India food joints , Sim LIM Square , Niranjan is within 1 km from the place.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel..!!”
Reviews.Author: Tejas_m29
Reviews.Content: When you enter in the hotel it feels great..!!! It has a huge lobby having water falls small water ponds etc..Also there are many different type of fishes in the ponds.The looby is really great. The hotel is quite big and is mostly crowded by indians.It has a great indian restaurant.The hotel is situated in good locality from where all the markets and tourist places are comparatively nearby.The hotel also has a swimming pool which is good.The rooms are not that spacious and are not so clean also.From the view of cleanliness the hotel is average.Considering the locality its good.There are many indian restaurants nearby the hotel and also good local markets.Had a good experience in this hotel with my family.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at Landmark Village Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amit N S
Reviews.Content: Dear Frineds , I have stayed at this hotel from 22nd January 2012 till 27th January 2012 . This is very funny hotel with respect to a nornal common traveller , as well as to a high-end traveller who is looking for class & perfection . I will summarise my funniest experiance which i have got in this hotel :- 1. Like many other guys , my day start with reading newspaper with a cup of tea . But i could not get any newspaper from hotel . When i enquired on the first day , i got very stupid response from room service as " They provide news paper only to the guests who book their rooms dirctly with them . Since i had booked my room through travel agent , i was not supposed to get any news paper " . Further , they advised me to purchase the newspaper from 7/11 shop which is across the road . The lady at reception also duly informed me that the newspaper costs only 90 cents , so i should purchase one , if i am not able to survive without it , and she hanged up the phone afterwards . Needless to say , i purchased the newspaper everyday afterwards. 2. This is probably the only hotel in the world where the calls to reception , room service , and even calls to duty manager's number gets un-answered . Believe me , they simply do not pick up the phone at all to listen to the customer !! ......What an attitude in hospitality industry ! 3. There is no free internet connection provided to the guests . 4. There are four lifts in the hotel , but they are not synchronised . So at times when you push the call button , all four lifts will come to your floor simultenously , and at times , none will come at all . If you have to attend some event or tour package , pls add minimum 20 minutes in your waiting time , for the lift see-saw game . 5. There is a indian restaurent at 5th floor & a chinese restaurent at 3rd floor , but none of them are attached with the hotel . So , if you order anything for room service ( And if you are lucky enough that your phone call is answered ) , than you have to pay additiponal charges . 6. The Breakfast & lunch menu is same everyday . Either there is no intensional veriation by management , or their sheff simply doesn't know how to cook other things . 7. The rooms and interior decorations are pathetic . And the attached bathroom is too small. The carpet gives the feeling of the era of 1700 B.C. , when carpets were first invented ! 8. People at reception behave as if they are giving alms to customer . No Smile , No Sorry , No Thanx kind of at all . Very uncultured staff , i must say !! Few Good Things :- 1. Despite all issues , quality & taste of food was good in both restaruents . 2. Hotel is centrally located 3. Mr. Ravi , who is the owner of 7/11 Shop across the rood is very nice & helpful man . He is unknowlingly helping this pathetic hotel , by helping the customers who manage to reach him . All the points mentioned above are based on my very recent personal experiance . If there is any clarification required , pls feel free to contact me on amitnsrivastav@rediffmail.com. Thanx & Best Regards Amit

Reviews.Title: “a very reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: J767-200
Reviews.Content: Introuction: This was my first time to Singapore and I wanted to find a mid-budget hotel with a good location and a few ‘perks’ to add to the experience (i.e. pool, free wi-fi internet, range of tv channels). Good Points: - Excellent location – near to Bugis MTR station and bus stops - Very Comfortable bedding - Modern flat-screen tv with plenty of channels - Rooms cleaned and made up well each today (good range of free soap/shampoo etc) - All usual room facilities provided and serviceable (fridge, hair-dryer, iron and board etc) - Free internet included in room price - 4 fast lifts - 2 free bottles of water provided daily Bad Points: - Curtains let far too much light in - Fridge had a habit of ‘juddering’ and vibrating in the night as it turned on and off which didn’t help sleep quality - Air Conditioning control was a dial rather than digital control which made it difficult to control temp accurately - One side of bed did not have bed-side table or a socket which made it difficult - After around 4pm the pool area (although not officially closed) was often being prepared for evening functions not practically useable - Reception desk staff acceptable but not overly helpful by any means. Conclusion: On the whole, despite this hotel probably having its heyday in the 1980s/early 90s when it was a 4 star, it is still of a very reasonable standard and makes a pleasant 3 star. Its key selling point is its location, but aside from that the pool area is nice and the standard of rooms quite good. Although in places the room’s appearance (especially the bathroom) and the carpets is somewhat old and ‘tired’ looking, everything was clean and fully serviceable. On that basis the Landmark Village Hotel offers good value for money for anyone seeking mid-budget accommodation in a central location.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that has seen better days…”
Reviews.Author: jk121255
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Landmark Village Hotel (formerly known as the Golden Landmark ) a few years ago so decided to stay again on a recent trip. This hotel is decently priced (for Singapore) but shows signs of a hotel past its prime. The room/furniture/fixtures & fittings have definitely seen better days. The carpet was worn, the wood of the door frames cracked and the décor dated. The vanity in the bathroom had water stains around the tap which was a result of poor maintenance – the tap leaked when turned on. The plumbing of the building must have been old because an unpleasant smell would emanate from the bathroom drains after using hot water. There were also a few issues that occurred during our stay. We booked through an online travel service, and the package included free wifi. The hotel had not recorded this so we had to sort this out with the hotel staff, who were quick to resolve the issue. The room did not have a hotel services guide, which I like to have so I know what the charges are for using hotel amenities. I called the front desk and housekeeping five times to have a book brought up to my room. On one occasion a staff member brought up a walking guide for the area, and on another occasion a menu which consisted of a few pieces of paper stapled together. On the remaining occasions, the staff just failed to deliver.I gave up in the end and came to the conclusion that a services guide did not exist – I would have liked to have been told that in the first place so that I did not have to keep following it up. The kettle in the room smelled like coffee (as if a previous occupant had used the kettle to actually brew the beverage), so we asked for a new kettle. The replacement kettle that was brought up was actually broken. The next call I made, I had to specify that I did not want a kettle that smelled or that was not broken. We also did not realise that housekeeping will not service your room unless you specifically put the “make up room” sign on your door. Many of the hotel staff are not good at English so you must speak slowly and precisely. Despite the issues, the hotel staff are polite and do try to be accommodating, and although the room was old, it was clean. The bed was comfortable and it was quiet. The hotel is also located in a very convenient area, about 15 minutes from Changi Airport, and a 2 minute walk from the Bugis MRT (subway) station which will allow you to travel easily to other areas in Singapore, eg. Orchard road. The Bugis Junction shopping precinct and street market are nearby, offering lots of shopping and food options.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay”
Reviews.Author: viveksr
Reviews.Content: I have stayed second time on last 7 months in landmark village hotel. The best thing is it’s in heart of the area where there are lots of bargain hunting shops. Connectivity in city is excellent, Bugis MRT station is at walking distance about 240 mtrs and the bus stop is 200 mtrs near Raffles Hospital. Rooms are average and the restaurants are pretty average with same repeated menu. Bar in room is kept emptied (I am not sure for the reason) and cleanliness is average.

Reviews.Title: “Good Abode in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Nitin_blr
Reviews.Content: Centrally located. Convenient for everything like shopping, food, sight seeing etc. Rooms are quite good except the AC. This time the AC was very cold with no controls. The travel desk is quite good, though some negotiations are reqd. The Indian restaurant also is good. Shopping complex just next to hotel, makes it possible for last minute shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Deeksha25
Reviews.Content: We had gone ro singapore for a short official tour , must say this was the best choice we made as the hotel is centrally located everything was on a ten minutes drive or 2 MRT station away The hotel rooms are good , comfortable and the staff gOes out of their way to make the stay even better :) Choose this hotel for a good value for money holiday or business trip....

Reviews.Title: “Brrrr The AC worked”
Reviews.Author: HeinB4
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights. Yes the AC worked but only at 10 degrees Celsius. Requests to have the thermostat fixed resulted in the AC being switched off on the second night. Fortunately I had clothing for an onward colder destination to survive the first evening. The rooms are spacious but the bathroom very tiny with poor lighting. The hotel is dated and the service is...well just poor. The breakfast was very basic.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: asakthivel
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1 .Close to Bugis shopping area 2. Close to cheap south Indian food and biryani. 3. Travel Desk did an excellent job to get me the Night safari package and Sentosa package. 4. Good to shop some Indian garments (if you are not from India) 5. Clean rooms 6. Breakfast was good Cons: 1. Dated Hotel 2. Cost 15$ to the airport by Taxi and any other major tourist attraction. However you have the option to use the metro which is cheaper option.

Reviews.Title: “It is ok only”
Reviews.Author: Heryanti
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. Got a room on the 14th floor. Personally, I feel the hotel is ok, it seems to be recently refurbished. The king bed is really huge and also the room is rather spacious for singapore standards, I guess. There is an iron and ironing board in room, so no need to wait hours like in some hotel to use the iron. Toiletries were also provided and requests to change the bedsheet were prompt. No issues about any smell (didn't smell any). However the husband felt that this hotel was not up to standard and the airconditioning was too cold and not easily adjusted by self. The location of the hotel is good too, very accesible to many sights and shops. The checking-out could be improved as we waited for quite some time before we were attended to and it was a Monday afternoon so it wasn't peak period but there was only 1 officer at the desk. Overall, I'm not too picky so this hotel is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Double Trouble”
Reviews.Author: vietpete
Reviews.Content: Having stayed previously at a sister hotel (Albert Court) I was somewhat aghast at finding myself booked into the Landmark Village by my employers. My fears were well founded - reasonably sized room, but very 'distressed' furnishings, tiny bathroom with shower/taps literally falling apart, and a pungent odor which seemed to pervade the corridors as well as the bathroom. I tried the Chinese restaurant, which seemed to be pretty much unused, and left when the waitress walked past, casually tossing a menu on the table as she passed. The clientele seemed to be predominantly south Asian, and this reflects in the services offered. Whilst $200 ++ a night might be reasonable in Singapore, it compares very badly with the value offered in other Asian cities. There will not be a 3rd Village experience.

Reviews.Title: “7 day getaway”
Reviews.Author: glennroymd
Reviews.Content: This is my second time to stay at this hotel and it is very good value for money. The staff are courteous and helpful. Very professional and the buffet has a number of choices we were a group of 25 that stayed for a conference and for Christmas. It is very convenient and is near Bugis and shops. The travel agent inside helped us book for Universal studios. I would recommend it for families and couples alike.

Reviews.Title: “I will always remember it as Golden landmark”
Reviews.Author: shanks123
Reviews.Content: I have been a frequent visitor to singapore for quite some years now . I have stayed in Quite a few hotels in singapore , As always my favorite has been the landmark hotel . It is cost effective , the staff are helpful in nature . Most of the things which could be accomodated are done in a very professional way . I have some relatives in singapore and from this hotel little india is in fact walkable distance ( depends on how much you can walk ) . As always once you enter little india you feel like you are roaming around the chennai streets . The hotel is comfortable and I have always liked the way it conducts it self . Apart from airports , this is one of the first places where I had actually taken a escaltor !!! I have many fond memories of this hotel . Always a great fan.

Reviews.Title: “Hotels with all Amenties”
Reviews.Author: VaishaliMaru
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 12. We felt the place absolutely fantastic. The rooms are medium and the service was awesome. The staff were very prompt with attending our queries. Near to Buggi's Station and Buggi's Street. 15-20 walks to Mustafa. The Travel Agent inside the Hotel helped us a lot. We bought attarction tickets at discounted rate.

Reviews.Title: “A good experience”
Reviews.Author: Himanshu_CHD
Reviews.Content: Hi, we are a young couple from India. We visited this hotel on 15thDec2011. As we were before check-in time so I thought to ask the receptionist If advanced check-in is possible.The receptionist was professional but good and gave me a room till evening and asked me to shift to my booked room in evening. So at least we got a room immediately to take some rest. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and hygienic and were taken care of daily. The only hitch was that the washroom did not have proper exhaust for fresh air ventilation it was all left to the centrally air conditioned system for ventilation. The room had fridge, kettle, Microwave, coffee making stuff etc which came in very handy. Also, specially for Indians the hotel provides Indian buffet breakfast which is decent. The location was good as Little India was 15-20 minutes walk. The bugis MRT and bugis village market was 5 minutes walk. The check-out was in early morning but again was smooth enough. Only thing that bothered me was they blocked 100 Singapore Dollars off my credit card during check-in and they are yet to be unblocked.

Reviews.Title: “Ahh, the golden retro experience of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: vincentchin88
Reviews.Content: Clean and uninspiring. A hotel that lives a liveable life and encourages you to explore the small city state. It tries to live up to today's deco but the added laminated wood to the lobby and your room cannot hide its 80s golden era. I am not sure of the rest of you guys, but when the lift door opened, I can only imagine that the air was from 3 decades ago. Otherwise, it is unpretentious, clean and a location-feature hotel for a business stay when time spent in room is minimum.

Reviews.Title: “Great Leader & Great Service & Great Team”
Reviews.Author: Doug S
Reviews.Content: I am a American and have been working in Indonesia for the last 16+ years, and came to Singapore so many times, and stayed at many different hotels (5 star).etc. I now work for Fluor Corporation, and took a new job in Mongolia last year and travel through Singapore on roster breaks. My company Fluor (travel) orignaily scheduled me to stay at the Land Mark Village Hotel, as this hotel is next door to the Mongolian Embassy. When I arrived and checked in at the reception desk, this gentleman, came up to me, and introduced himself as Andrew Tan (Assistant Front Office Manager). Saying this, I have never had a front office manager welcome me to his hotel, in my 35 years of traveling, and don't anyone else who has. This guy and his team have made my many stays at the Land Mark an absolute pleasure. The service is great, and the location is walking distance, and short taxi rides (<S$ 5.00 or S$6:00), and the taxi service seems to be always be availble at the Land Mark for some reason. The bottom line, the quality of my stay at this hotel has made me feel like it was my home away from home, and would recommend to anyone looking for a happy stay, the Land Mark Village is the place.

Reviews.Title: “it was nice”
Reviews.Author: shs92
Reviews.Content: good hotel with average service.facilities in the room are very nice. the comfort level is good.the hotel has a good pool and a good fitness centre. it is brilliently located with most shopping destinations at a walkable distance. there a few shops and currency converter at the enterence of the hotel itself. the restaurants food is good.specially the indian food. transport facilities available at the hotels doorstep itself. staff is decent as well.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: Familytravellers08
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews of this hotel, I was not sure what to expect! I stayed here with my two sisters and elderly mother in adjoining rooms on the 17th floor in an "executive room". The rooms were comfortable, clean and had all we needed. We had a problem with the safes, but after a call to housekeeping, was fixed in no time. We found all the staff very courteous and could not do enough to help. We loved the drinks and nibbles in the Executive Lounge and found the staff on duty there incredibly friendly. It was a chance to meet other guests staying at the hotel and enjoy beautiful views of the city. We found the breakfasts to be somewhat average, but enough to keep us going! The proximity of the hotel to the Bugis MRT was fantastic and we utilised both trains and buses. The hotel is very close to some wonderful eating places around Arab Street and we were able to walk everywhere without a problem and enjoy not only the cheap food but some quirky shops in beautiful old buildings. I am returning to Singapore in January 2012 and have booked this hotel once again for my family. I consider it to be fantastic value for money whilst staying in an executive room. Very much looking forward to another wonderful stay at "Landmark Village Hotel"!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice, great location”
Reviews.Author: girgray
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel for a short stay. Spacious rooms, clean bathrooms, good view, good location (arab street) makes it a convenient place to stay in Singapore. It s close to SIM LIM square (walkable distance), so all those eager to buy cell phones will find it convenient. Service is good. Overall, a comfortable and a convenient place to chose in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Get ready to meet the rudest people EVER”
Reviews.Author: 1234travelbuff1234
Reviews.Content: I had the most awful time at Landmark Village. The reception staff was rude and unhelpful. Once we checked in, we were shocked to find that our bathroom was dirty, the bath tub had stains, the lamp in the bedroom had expletives written on them, there was no room service menu and the fridge was empty except for a half eaten kit kat chocolate! A low class hotel will also have a well stocked fridge. When we left for breakfast on the 5th floor, the woman at the desk looked at us up and down and said ,"The indian breakfast is on 3rd floor, are u sure you want to go in?". We were shocked with her comment. When we approached the reception to use the internet, the reception lady didnt even bother looking up and looked sullen and disgusted. The people at the reception are the most pathetic, rude and immature employees i have ever come across. When we came back after a day of sight seeing at 6, our room wasnt even cleaned! and when we called housekeeping, they made us wait for 2 hours at the reception so they can clean the room, surprisingly, the chocolate was still there! Apart from a good location, i would not recommend this hotel to anybody

Reviews.Title: “False advertising on the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rosalind Riza M
Reviews.Content: I was very dissapointed with the hotel. Staff we not helpful and unfriendly. Room stinks and the carpet is so old that rugged. The whole hotel needs a good clean and smells really old. Not a good experience at all and I do not recommend you staying at this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “If you are from India. . you will love it.”
Reviews.Author: Sharadmandale
Reviews.Content: mostly suited for Indian tourists. located near Little India, a favorite shopping place fellow Indians. Food quality is good, serving Indian and Oriental. Service is good.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Service”
Reviews.Author: John W
Reviews.Content: I have stayed quite a number of times in this hotel before and always had a good experience. The hotel is great, the location is prefect and the staff are friendly efficient. Last Friday I checked out around 12 noon to attend a meeting and left my large luggage to collect later before catching a 6.30PM flight. I got delayed at my meetings and the traffic downtown was really bad, so I call the hotel to know if they could send my luggage to my meeting location.... otherwise there was no way I would make my flight.The Front Office Manager Andrew Tan said he would attend to my request, but could not get a taxi to do the run so he himself drove to my meeting location (close to the airport) and delivered my bag to me personally. Wow ..what service .... where in the world can you get service like this today ? A big thanks to Andrew and all his hotel staff. THANK YOU. Make sure you put this hotel on your list of excellent hotels in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: Mohit18
Reviews.Content: oh..it was a wonderful stay. especially for Indians.. good rooms, good staff, good view, everything was very nice and as i mentioned earlier, for Indians, its a perfect place to stay, with very good Indian buffet dinner and lunch. we just loved this place.

Reviews.Title: “LANDMARK RIPOFF”
Reviews.Author: beijingbobLouisiana
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Landmark Village while waiting for my apartment to be ready. The hotel laundry is broken most of the time but for the samll sum of 11.50, they will wash a pair of jeans. If you want to use the internet, it will cost you 10.00 a day, or you can simply walk outside on the street, get a cold beer for a third of what they charge, and use the free Wi Fi. The cook is late so if you have to go to work, plan on watered down scrambled eggs for breakfast. Also, my AC has broken twice. Go to Galong and get a cheap room. That is much better.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay”
Reviews.Author: flyingdutchdude
Reviews.Content: Close to the MRT and makes the trip into the main drag walkable, the lobby is viny shiny in a 70's retro kinda way. Front desk staff were friendly and helpful. Room was simple, but very dated with significant wear and tear the bathroom in particular. Bed was hard and the air con rattled a bit. Pool area is pretty funky, like I said - average experience. Might not visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: sudipnandy
Reviews.Content: Centrally Located. Close to Underground Station. 7x11 convenience store, Mc D, KFC all located across the road. One Bus operator to KL opposite to the hotel. Clean, large rooms with great view. Free Breakfast with the room, quite a few options. Good money exchange right on the ground floor of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My address at Singapore”
Reviews.Author: S_Pravasi
Reviews.Content: I have been many times to Singapore and for most of the visits, this has been my staying place. I would not rate the room and service excellent. But the location and for Indian travellers the restaurants make it an ideal place to live. The room and bell boy service is almost nil as in most Singapore hotels. Earlier they didn't offer Indian breakfast but not they've added. They've come down on some facilities like giving bathroom slippers and bath gown etc. after attaching to Village group. Their rooms have varied facilities on different floors but the tariff is same.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable for the price you pay”
Reviews.Author: zmyusof
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a bit dated I must say but for me the reason for choosing this hotel is for the location and the price. You can always pay more if you want to stay in a nicer hotel. Although it is still considered expensive for average Malaysian like me but considering the rates of other hotels in Singapore, I believe the rate for this hotel is acceptable. I got upgraded to Deluxe room which basically meant same room but higher floors. The hotel is located in the heart of Arab Street so Halal and Muslim food is in abundance. Universal Studios by the way is just a 10-15 minutes taxi ride from the hotel. I must say the hotel is quite popular with tourist from India, but I suppose this is seasonal.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money”
Reviews.Author: Solmum
Reviews.Content: Excellent service. Pay the extra and go Executive Class - free breakfast, free Exec lounge use, free Internet, free happy hour drinks. They could not do enough to make our stay comfortable. Best service in a hotel we have ever had!

Reviews.Title: “Moved to a different hotel after 1 night”
Reviews.Author: OldLawnGnome
Reviews.Content: 3 of us were traveling on business and were booked into this hotel as other reasonably priced hotels were not available. Each of us had issues with their rooms. A common problem was mold in the bathrooms, stains on the very worn carpet, and everything being very old and worn. My telephone had a horrible buzz and when a person called from the US it took several tries for them to even answer the switchboard. Also reserved room types were not available when checking in. Internet was S$26 a day. If you are on a tight budget, and will put up with inconveniences then this might be for you.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely unorganized motel!!”
Reviews.Author: jjw62au
Reviews.Content: We arrived there and two people in our group became sick in the middle of the night, we were taken to the hospital next door by staff, no problems!! It was after this the problems arose. We had rung the hotel and asked that the room be paid for via the credit card that was already swiped there for the next couple of days, they said no problem. Our daughter who is 14 came back from the hospital to gather clothing to stay with us in the hospital. She was locked out of the room and told she would have to pay them cash now and that she owed them money now! She said her mum was in the hospital next door and she had no money, she was disgruntledly given a new key to the room. After being discharged from hospital we all went back to the motel and asked for a late checkout, which cost $102 extra. We asked to have our room made up that day and were told we could not as we were checking out that day, we said we had a late checkout at 6pm and were told no!! I made the room up myself, still feeling unwell and needing sleep before our flight back to Australia that day. We were woken up three times between 1pm and 6pm by staff. Twice by staff saying we should be out of that room and we had to leave, even unlocking and entering the room seeing my semi naked daughter getting out of the shower! And once by cleaning staff ready to make the beds for us, the thing we were told we were not eligible for that day! So much for getting a restful sleep before the trip home.

Reviews.Title: “a little tired”
Reviews.Author: chnnang
Reviews.Content: i spent a couple of nights here in august 2011 on a business trip. the location was excellent as i needed to spend most of my time around the bugis area. service was good and the staff were helpful. the rooms contained everything you need but the whole hotel seems to be showing it's age a little. everything worked fine and i had no complaints, it's a good deal for the price i paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WhitelilySydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Landmark Hotel over the F1 Grand Prix weekend. EASY walking access to Gate 1 of the circuit. On reading many reviews prior to our holiday we were abit wary of what the hotel would turn out like, but found it to be great. We were on the 15th floor and had a king size bed. The bathroom was fine (having read reviews of mould in the bathroom) and our room wasn't outdated or old. The airconditioning was heaven after the outside heat and the pool area was lovely. The service was very good as well. Within easy walking distance of Bugis station and markets. Would stay there again !

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel apart from location”
Reviews.Author: zakir460
Reviews.Content: This is a well reputable hotel. Service was excellent. We took taxi all the time and there was no problem finding a taxi apart from the usual rush hour. I can only think of a down side is the location. Its middle of nowhere but it all depends what you are really after. Its not close to orchard road or to the Marina Bay/Bay area. But what is has is quiet, friendly and good for families if you don't mind the taxi charges

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: foxypiggy
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review from the 'comfort' of the hotel room. I could have made better use of my time, enjoying the breakfast. However, the so-called 'wide variety' of buffet spread at the cafe in the lobby has limited food. I could list the food they have which is a maximum of 10 cooked food items eg plain congee, beef sausage, scrambled eggs, vegetarian noodles, ham, potato wedges, fried spring rolls, pancake, baked beans and an egg station. We booked an executive club room and could have enjoyed our breakfast in the lounge. However, they have only 6 cooked food items which took them a long time to replenish as there were a number of guests. Rooms: Before making our reservation, we called the hotel to make sure they have smoking executive club rooms. The staff on duty told us they do have smoking executive club rooms and hence we made the booking. Upon check in, we were given a smoking room on the 19th floor, one level above the executive lounge, which is common in many hotels. We did not suspect anything was wrong then. When we reached the room, boy did we get a shock! The room has a horrible stench. My husband who is a smoker cannot even stand the stench! The room has a 2-panel window and the room was extremely dim! The room was also rather run-down. We had asked the staff over the phone the night before and they told us that their guests are usually satisfied when they upgrade to the executive club rooms and that these rooms are the newer ones. However, the room before our eyes then definitely looked old and run-down. We immediately approach the front desk again to ask for a change of rooms. It was then we learnt that the 19th floor rooms aren't executive club rooms. They are deluxe rooms! The lady at the front desk told us that for guests requesting for smoking executive club rooms, they will just put them in the smoking deluxe rooms and change the amenities to that of the executive club room. We were appalled as such acts are definitle dishonest! We were then given a non-smoking room at the 18th floor which was brighter and slightly newer. However, it was definitely inconvenient for my husband. The room wasn't well-cleaned as there were dirt and stains left by the previous occupant on the bedside table. We were also told by the staff that this room comes with a standing shower only. We made do with that as long as the room is better than the previous room. However, when we saw the toilet, we laughed at the size of it. It was so small, that you'll need to stand aside in order to close the door and then get to the small standing shower. Service: Check in was alright. I even told my husband that the service here seems to make up for the not-up-to-Mark rooms. I was too quick to make that remark and I take my words back. One of the executive club lounge lady who was on night shift was excellent. She was very professional and was always smiling no matter how busy she was. For that, I give her my applause. However, the next morning, when we had our pathetic breakfast, the staff there seemed like she had a bad morning. Not only she didn't smile at us, when my husband asked her about the breakfast, she didn't even look at him and carried on with what she was doing! My husband and I were disgusted by her acts! We then personally go to the front desk to ask for the check out time as our room package comes with a complimentary late check-out but were not told of the time upon check-in. To our astonishment, the front desk lady and another gentleman told us check out for us is at 12pm after checking their system. My husband then asked what is the usual check out time if the late check out is at 12pm for us. I showed them my confirmation email which stated very clearly my entitlements. The gentleman then said the latest they can give us is at 2pm. We were put off by what we heard because it was as if we asked for it and not our entitlement. The gentleman added that he couldn't give us any later than 2h after 12pm as they will then have to charge us! What he said shows very clearly that he does not have a good understanding of what the hotel offers to the guests. We asked to speak with the manager and were taken aback when that gentleman told is that he is the manager! Location: Good for tourists who want a central location (near the MRT) without paying exorbitant prices. It isn't directly opposite Bugis Junction as shown in the map. It is opposite Raffles hospital and you will have to walk past the hospital to get to Bugis Junction which is 5+ minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: BCooper123
Reviews.Content: Its a nice hotel near Bugis MRT and Arab Street. Their Breakfast is a very good spread and caters to Indian guests as well. Rooms are nice. We were in a pool facing room on the 10th Floor. Lots of dinning options around this hotel but most of them shut early in the night (By 8pm). however there is a 7/11 shop close by which sells god sandwiches and rolls.

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel”
Reviews.Author: VSM70
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for about 4 days in May 2011. The hotel just seemed full of Indians - at least at the time we were put up. From an Indian point of view, the location of this hotel is convenient- being close to Little India. Another plus point on location is that it is just a couple of minutes walk away from Bugis station. Other wise the hotel seemed just an average one. Although It is part of the village theme of hotels in Singapore this hotel did not exhibit any special village theme or preservation of traditional themes or arts of Singapore in its premises. There is hardly any space at the main entrance of this hotel. The lobby is at the third floor and the Indian restaurant on the fifth floor and lifrs were not efficient. The room is quite small and was a bit stale. Being a family of four (2 aadults + 2 kids) with the extra bed in place , the room became quite cramped. Being vegetarians, we went only to the Indian restaurant. I would say it is just about an average restaurant. the food quality was Ok. The reaturant desperately needed cleanliness measures and the staff a training on it. The staff was always in a hurry and did not have time even to respond to your query (except the manager at the billing counter who took all the time in the world to print the bill). They also have tables outside the restaurant next to the pool but staff attention is near zero at those tables. We were waiting for eternity for the order to be placed. To sum it up, the hotel needs a major image makeover.

Reviews.Title: “We love the location”
Reviews.Author: TotaraPakaranga
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel from Expedia early bird booking, which were fairly good price. As prices for Singapore hotels are very expensive. The Hotel itself is average. Reception service were excellent. Very helpful. We got the Deluxe room, which was on the 8th floor. Very clean and a massive king bed, it was so comfortable that we slept thru the morning got up after one pm. Did not try out the swimming pool. Its near Bugis and Arab street. Shopping and eating for local things are the best. The nearest MRT is at bugis Junction. Little India was not very far too. We would come back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: no1kingfisher
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel in the extcutive rooms for 7 years now. The staff are friendly and helpful. The rooms are good, clean and comfortable. Reasonable breakfast and plenty of it - self service. A good ventral location to Bugis Junction.

Reviews.Title: “Oh dear, oh dear”
Reviews.Author: jdassoc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well positioned on the Arab Street just around the corner from one of the largest Mosques in Singapore. The hotel is a little older and is in real need of both some renovation and some organization. My room came with Wi-Fi and breakfast but the Wi-Fi did not work for the first three days and despite numerous phone calls could never be brought into operation with the login that was given, in the end the telephone support engineer just gave up and issued a completely different login that worked for the last three days of my stay, however despite five bars of signal strength the connection speeds were so slow as to make the connection really quite useless for anything but the simplest surfing. There were two breakfast areas one normal and one with an Indian theme. The normal breakfast area was in the Chinese restaurant on the same level as reception. The area was so crowded on the occasions I tried to have breakfast there that the tables were all being shared with strangers, also the staff seemed to have an aversion to cleaning the tables and the atmosphere was nonexistent. The Indian version on the 5th floor was better on the first occasion that I tried it with a variety of tasty Indian style breakfast dishes but on the second occasion the two coach parties that were squashed in made it almost as bad at the main breakfast venue. I tried to go the in house Indian Restaurant on one evening and after waiting for about five minutes by the please wait to be seated desk was told that normal restaurant food would not be served there but on the sixth floor instead, no reason was given for this. I went up to the sixth floor only to find a sort of buffet in the corridor leading to some other desolate rooms, I asked the girl who ran up to me if this was supposed to be a restaurant and she confirmed that in her opinion it was however as I was of a different opinion I went elsewhere that night. My room had very dirty carpet and furniture that was falling quite literally to pieces. The bed was extremely hard and the room was very loud when anyone was in the corridor or the room next door due to the connecting door that let all the noise through. It was necessary to prop a chair against the doors to the wardrobe as it contained an automatic light that would not go out without significant pressure being applied to the door. There were two escalators up from the entrance to the 3rd floor reception and in all the time I was there only the up escalator was working. The elevators which were the alternative seemed to have a programming that maximized the wait time which was truly atrocious on the weekend due to the number of people arriving, leaving and trying to access the restaurants. I had to wait 15 minutes before I could get into one to go up to my room only to find that yet again the magnetic strip on my room key did not work in the access slot which was necessary to be activated before you could select your floor. In total I got through five keys in three days before I finally got one that worked. I am quite used to these sort of key and am aware that they should be kept away from cell phones and other cards so this was not the problem. I believe that they are using the cards to often before replacing them and this would fit into the rest of the hotels style. You might ask why I did not try to change my room, well I looked at other room which were open for cleaning and they all seemed to be about the same. I know this all sounds a bit extreme and I do try to be fair in my reviews but this hotel is really that bad and I cannot recommend it in any way.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel in Bugis”
Reviews.Author: Gixxerscott
Reviews.Content: When I arrived the room I was assigned had two beds, even though the front desk had said it was a queen. After being assigned a different room, which I was told was an upgrade, I exited the elevator to a badly stained hall carpet and the aroma of urine. After traveling 35 hours, and prepaying, I reluctantly proceeded to the room, which was smaller than the original room I had been assigned, and had one small window the corner of the room. The room was very unsanitary and there was black mold covering about 30% of the grout in the bathroom. Upon checkout I was informed that my credit card was charged, even though I had called before booking to discuss paying cash, was told to make a note on booking.com, which I did, and had given a cash deposit upon my arrival. This was the worst booking and hotel experience, and I travel frequently, of my life.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: grk75
Reviews.Content: Its a good hotel, centrally located, very close to Bugis Village shopping area & Bugis metro station is also very closeby. Mustafa is 10 to 15 mins walking from the Hotel. It has an Indian Restaurant at the 5th Level of the hotel. The hotel is connected to a small shopping mall. The staff is co-operative, neat & clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “ok after initial checkin”
Reviews.Author: Les Breen
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for 3 nights in July 2011 Arriving later at night it took some time to check in as a big tour group arrived just before us. On receiving out room key we took the elevator to the floor we were booked into a room on to be greeted by the overwhelming smell of stale cigarettes and on entering our room the smell was even worse. Fortunately the porter was there at the room with our luggage and he said that he would go to reception to try and change to a non smoking floor . My partner went with him as we were upgraded to a "Club"room on the 16th floor . Had we been asked at reception if we required a non smoking room this could have been avoided , but the hotel was quite helpful inupgrading us . The staff generally very helpful .Good pool area with very cool water A good area to stay in close to Little India and away from Orchard Road Les Breen

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: rumpunchLondon
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Singapore to celebrate my son's wedding and the reception was booked at this hotel. With my wife & 5 yr old daughter we were upgraded to the executive floor. On arrival we were greeted warmly, especially by the duty manager Andrew Tan. As mentioned in other reviews the wifi rates are expensive but with Andrew's assistance we were able to negotiate better rates. The hotel catering for the reception was excellent, which was staged by the outdoor swimming pool on the 5th floor. The bedroom was roomy as it easily accomodated our king size bed and extra bed for my daughter. The hotel is centrally located with easy access to the shopping & transport facilities of Bugis. There are swankier hotels in Singapore but for the deal we got it would be hard to beat The Landmark

Reviews.Title: “Good option on a budget family Singapore stay”
Reviews.Author: MonWaz
Reviews.Content: This was a good option in Singapore on a budget. Had never been to the Arab Quarter where this hotel was located and it turned out to be quite good. Close to Little India also. Bugis MRT and shops only a block or two away. The pool area was a major positive as it was big and the area around it had plenty of space. The room itself was tight but we only needed to sleep in there really. The Grand Mosque nearby was picturesque. Service wasn't above and beyond but they did the bare essentials ok. I would stay here again for the price. The main thing lacking was a breakfast option nearby as we didn't have a deal. We went to McDonalds at Bugis a couple of times.

Reviews.Title: “Pit(s) stop!”
Reviews.Author: dipsroy
Reviews.Content: Its a pretty big hotel and very close to the heart of the city - those are the only two redeeming features of this hotel! One is likely to be overwhelmed by the excess air -freshner and number of people and baggage one has to encounter as one enters the hotel (the lobby/reception is on the 3rd floor and the concierge is on the ground floor and its very likely that one may have to wait quite a while after one has checked-in for the luggage to reach the room ). The funny part about this hotel is that none of the departments seem to answer their phone - we stayed in the hotel for 5 nights and whenever we tried calling the front desk or room service or even the operator, the phone, more often than not, would go unanswered and this was not in odd hours or after hours! So if you are travelling with family and are likely to spend more time in the hotel, then its best to avoid this hotel! And even if you are not travelling with family, then there are hotels in the area to choose from- if one is going to spend big bucks, then one might as well get some service for it. The hotel's wi-fi rates are exorbitant and it makes sense to take a cab or walk it down to internet cafe's near Bugis Village market - the browsing rate at the internet cafe plus the cab fare work out cheaper than the hotel's wifi rates!

Reviews.Title: “Solid and functional, terrible internet”
Reviews.Author: cluelessgoon
Reviews.Content: Visiting Singapore from New Zealand I stayed here in June 2011 for a week-long tech convention. This hotel caters very well for Indian visitors and I enjoyed meeting many of them in during my stay here. The hotel is pretty tired and in need of a refit but is mostly quite functional and useful. It's not luxury, but there is plenty of the out in the city. Good: Very very very helpful staff, large rooms, super-cold air-con, safe in room, large TV, iron, ironing table hangers. great view from the upper floors, nice breakfasts, very quiet rooms despite high occupancy, taxis always available, cleaning very good. Bad: Terrible internet, lifts often didn't work, very noisy Sunday night outdoor parties (but only until about 23:30)

Reviews.Title: “Good value in bad value Singapore”
Reviews.Author: travelinginasia
Reviews.Content: The prices of hotels in Singapore are too high for the standard you get. If you stay anywhere cheaper, don't expect windows or a pool! This hotel was good value when you compare it to other properties in Singapore. The staff were very friendly. Always helpful and smiling. I booked a superior room. The room was very run down, lights switches didn't work, etc. I wanted to use the internet in my room so went to reception to ask how much. It's $26/day for each device. Which means if you have an iphone and a laptop you'll have to pay $52/day! They offered me an upgrade to a club room for a very very resonable amount. The club room was renovated, had unlimited free wi-fi, breakfast in the club lounge, free cocktails and a late check out. This ended up being incredible value. Location is great being near Bugis MRT which is the same line as to the airport. Little India is very close. It took me about 10 minutes to walk to the Mustafa Centre and Serangoon Rd. If I was to return to Singapore I would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Resonable Hotel in the Prime Location near Bugis MRT”
Reviews.Author: Vivek369
Reviews.Content: I had been to Singapore for a Short Trip and stayed at the Landmark Village Hotel. The Best advantage of the Hotel was it was close to the Bugis MRT and you could easily move around the Busy places in Singapore in minutes. The Rooms were excellent and expensive, however the internet service was pathetic and we were unable to use the complimentary internet. The air conditioning was Centralized and the room used to Chill during the night. We didn't tried the restaurant as the Free Brakfast was denied on the day we checked in. Overall a positive experience. Thanks to free WiFi by SingTel.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: mrin_v
Reviews.Content: Large hotel right in the middle of the Kampong Glam area of Singapore, which makes it convenient if you're visiting and want to walk about a bit. Also attached to its own shopping mall, which seems de rigeur in Singapore. Close to the MRT at Bugis junction and Singapore is generally easy to navigate and walk about. Clean, efficient staff. I was there for a conference and was hosted by the organisers, so can't comment on things like what the bill settlement experience etc. was like, but check in and out was smooth. Great poo, though oddly-shaped, and super clean. There was a wedding one night which meant loud music till about 11, but other than that, was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best property in Bugis Area”
Reviews.Author: dipeshmehta
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at the hotel where we been offer a king size bedded room where my family of 2 adult and 2 children accomodated perfectly, rooms are vary spacious and the service of the hotel is also excellent, they serve indian dishes in breakfast , and also has a indian restaurant called tandoor , the MRT station bugis is just 100 mtrs from the hotel and the hotel is located on arab street and opposite is the best hospital of asia "raffles hospital" , few minutes walking is bugis village , sim lim center and tower and 10 minutes walk on other side is Mustafa Market, the hotel it self has a 2 storey shopping mall , i will definately stay at this hotel when ever i visit singapore

Reviews.Title: “To the attention of those who want to stay in this hotel !!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: coldblood_1973
Reviews.Content: Am not satisfied with the working people who never !!!!!!!! I came here from Turkey speak English very well and was not ....... When I sat down at your computer for the Internet, the computer breaks down in the lobby for the words upside down and I wanted to help officer in charge showed a woman uses the computer monitor and a hard right turned to me and said use this !!!!!!!!!!!! Emphasis on tourism in a country like Singapore, a large hotel in a central region to be a very big mistake !!!!!!!! such a hotel, a lobby attendant how to run without finishing olurda you so still do not understand ?????????? I tell all my friends who want to go or to Singapura this situation and do not stay at the hotel he warned that I would never !!!!!!!! Writing and send it to all sites on the Internet I could find !!!!!!! There is only one reason I find it ............. Other people, their money and outraged by the infamous not exposure to !!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Gnanavel
Reviews.Content: We were on a group tour. We reached the hotel by a couch from airport after a hectic half day sight seeing. The reception was quite slow and it took really a few hours to get the rooms allotted though several rooms were unoccupied. Courtesy was missing at the reception. Concierge failed to send baggage to rooms even after two hours!. The location of the hotel was splendid. Very conveniently located to may attractions. The upkeep of the hotel was nice with good amenities. The food at the restaurant wa really delicious with a well spread breakfast. House keeping team was courteous and efficient.The overall experience was very good. If a little more attention can be paid to reception desk and concierge, perhaps it would simply be the best.

Reviews.Title: “Not a true representation of Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: aus_world_traveller
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the landmark village Singapore. The location is fantastic, and provides the guests with never ending views of the island. Hotel situated in the Arab quarter, with bugis mrt a 2 minute walk away and little India a 5 minute walk. Hotel is very close to taxi and train. Easy to get a taxi and tours from the hotel too. Hotel is very close to bugis village shops and technological complexes. I found the reception staff not so friendly, no smiles or greeting. Just a rushed check in with no information on the property at all. The staff at mooi chin restaurant were wonderful, we ate our breakfast their daily. Freshly cooked food was always on offer at their morning buffet. The restaurant also has a large Indian restaurant on level 5. The lifts not so good either. Very slow and full during the mornings. Hotel is a great place to stay, but I feel it caters more for the Indian community.

Reviews.Title: “amazing location”
Reviews.Author: vishal1700
Reviews.Content: fantastic infrastructure, service and food . being an Indian getting spicy quality food as we indians like it. The rooms are adorable and cozy. as such Singapore is a fantastic country hats off to it. very convinient to travel the as Bugis MRT is just 1 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “Landmark Village Hotel, Not bad... not bad at all...”
Reviews.Author: Kylesligh
Reviews.Content: Landmark Village Hotel, Singapore Reception – The reception is not at the ground floor, I thinks it’s at the 4th or 2nd floor. Rooms – The room is spacious and nice. Not new but they have kept it well. See photo to see the room. Bathroom – clean. Noting fancy. Service – Good. Not with a smile but service is fair. Food – only had breakfast at this hotel. Buffet breakfast, nothing fancy. Location – Quite ok but not the best. Easy to get a cab and a few steps from the MTR. This hotel would be one of your best bet if you’re traveling on a budget. The place is ok but nothing fancy. I wouldn’t mind staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in a upgraded high floor room”
Reviews.Author: JJMumbai
Reviews.Content: As I was going to be staying for about 10 days, they upgraded me to high floor with complementary internet in the room. Hotel is located close to several restaurants, shopping malls and MRT station. Hotel has 2 restaurants, one serving Indian food and another serving Continental and Chinese food. Many private receptions are held in the area next to pool/garden, adjacent to the Indian restaurant. On such days, mostly on weekends, it is advisable to avoid the Indian restaurant. There is a decent fitness room in the hotel. Many budget tour operators also put their guests in the hotel. Hotel lobby is usually very crowded when the tour party arrives or leaves. Two casinos are not very far from the hotel. Even other tourist attractions are accessible from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, nothing great”
Reviews.Author: sujitmehta
Reviews.Content: our visit to landmark village was a decent one.. but cant say awesome as the property looks old. It is decently located but i wouldnt recommend to stay here. its good for a nights stay but not worth for a longer one.

Reviews.Title: “Best location for your stay at Singapore”
Reviews.Author: suvroghosh
Reviews.Content: This is great multistorey hotel...just next to Bugis MRT ...It is close to all shopping malls like Sim Lim square , Bugis street market The rooms are good with attached bath including bathtub ....Nice view of the greenery around. The swimming pool at 4th floor and another one at rooftop is good for relaxing..also the fitness centre. Breaffast included Indian & Continental options and the hotel is favourite of Indian and Bangladesh travellers The Travel & Tours counter at the lobby is very friendly and can arrange trips in very short time

Reviews.Title: “clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: twofortea85
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel clean, comfortable and value for money. If you want to stay central, then this is it, Arabtown, India town and Bugis Street (great for bargains). Flashy ot's not, elegant it's not, but value for money it is.

Reviews.Title: “A bit in need of a facelift, but otherwise a nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Aimbo43
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Landmark twice on both sides of the cruise I took out of Singapore. The staff was very friendly and informative. The location in the Arab Quarter was good, especially if you like to shop for fabrics. We walked every where around Singapore from here and even though it was farther away than a lot of the hotels, it was very doable. If you don't like to walk, the MRT station is right down the block. If you want to tour Singapore, the Hippo Hop on Hop off bus stops right behind the hotel. Get your tickets in the lobby of the hotel. The first room we stayed in was "recently renovated" which meant the TV was flat screen and the bathroom was newer looking. The second room was an older room with a box TV, and the bathroom was definitely in need of a face lift. Both rooms had very comfortable beds, and nice thick towels in the bathroom. They give you a free bottle of water in your room every day, and if you need more, 7-11 is across the street. Both rooms had a mini bar with fridge, and safe in the room. There were a lot of channels to choose from on the TV. Internet in the room was pricey, but if you don't mind waiting a few minutes, there are 2 computers in the lobby for guest use with free internet. Restaurants were very good especially the Indian restaurant on the 5th floor. If you are looking for the Ritz, this definitely isn't it but if you are looking for a nice place at a good price, and can overlook a few minor cosmetic issues, Landmark fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not for europeans”
Reviews.Author: Neil10x
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a traffic light away from Arab Street and many other attractions however it is severly lacking in customer comfort. There is no public lounge area and NO bar other than one by the pool which leaves a lot to be desired and is only open for a few hours. Get a drink here after dark, no way. The hotel has "delux rooms" from the 12th to the 15th floor, belive me their is a big difference in these rooms which all have the same price. Don't ever get the 12th floor. As to the staff, they are very robotic in theirs ways, help you, not often. This hotel suits the Indian and Asian cultures. Their is an Indian restaurant within the hotel. Also the internet connection was slow and very unreliable.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Padmini1969
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in an excellent location with MRT closeby. Food outlets, Nightlife is excellent around the hotel....Hotel rooms are tidy and spacious... Will recommend clients to stay in this hotel for the price and location of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I am enjoying my stay at the Landmark Village Hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: NorwegianZorro
Reviews.Content: Located central. Close to diverse restaurants, shops, malls, and walking distance to many cultural items Singapore has to offer. Service staff very friendly and efficient. Executive club products and staff very inviting, engaging, appreciative, and a delight after a busy work day. I like this Hotel and will stay here again. My wait for a taxi, when required, was very short. Located in an area that is so culturally diverse. Incredible.

Reviews.Title: “STAY CLEAR this place is JUNK, JUNK & Just JUNK!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sanket74
Reviews.Content: This is by far the worst hotel I have ever visited, believe me it absolute JUNK!!! The rooms are small & cramped, the carpets are dirty & stained, A/c is horrible & above all, the bathrooms are a nightmare... torn bath towels...broken or non functional bath fittings... no health faucets or jet sprays, the list just goes on. The hotel staff is also unhelpful & uncaring. The food at their Indian restaurant is unworthy of mention, repetitive menus and taste ranging from bad to worst. Overall a very lousy hotel. So, if you are a discerning DESI please stay away from this place

Reviews.Title: “Great location, so so quality”
Reviews.Author: Jisan
Reviews.Content: I preferred to stay around arab street as it is close to my office and great food. Location: 4/5 close to CBD (15 mins walk). on the arab street close to little india and a bugis junction Hotel: 3.5/5 1. Village landmark has old room; they definitely need service. 2. Haven't switched on the TV, its so 80s! 3. Internet access speed varies. I guess over the weekend its damn slow due to heavy usage. Only one connection is allowed. so if you have phone then sorry! 4. Rooms are clean, They provide water bottles. 5. Fewer staff at reception.Hence, you have to wait for the service. I'll prefer hotel Park royal on beach road over this one.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in the Heart of the City”
Reviews.Author: JohnsonGeorge
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel, Lovely Experience, Has sight seeing facilities inside, Good Breakfast and 2 lovely restarurants. 1 restaurant exclusively for Indian cuisine Very close to the shopping centers - Sim Lim Square, Mustafa, etc situated on Victoria Street

Reviews.Title: “Find somewhere else to stay”
Reviews.Author: Mdggnz
Reviews.Content: We unfortunatley booked this hotel for a 7 night stay, after 3 we left and found a 5 star property on orchard for less money per night. Very tired property, very unhelpful staff. the only positive thing i can say is that the sheets were clean and the beds well made, if it wasnt for this we wouldnt have stayed as much as 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST HOTEL IN SINGAPORE - I'd rather stay in Hotel 81”
Reviews.Author: jpflies
Reviews.Content: This is by far the worst hotel i have stayed in Singapore, the location is hard to reach, the service of the hotel is terrible the management staff just dont care about their guest at all. I made a booking and for 5 nights in this hotel, thinking that this would be a simple transaction with minimal interruptions. I was wrong!!! I had problems right from the very start from the booking to room confirmation to this Hotel then telling me that they are fully booked for a specific night and taking my already paid money just like that!!! DAY LIGHT ROBBERY!!! I will never recommend anyone staying in this hotel but only advise people to book elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't be my first choice to stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Ejswit
Reviews.Content: Tough place to get a nights rest, VERY noisy including two nights they had late night party's with LOUD music. Called the manager multiple times to no avail.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special...”
Reviews.Author: clarkme21
Reviews.Content: Singapore is already an expensive place to be, but this hotel was nickle and diming us throughout the whole stay. There was a computer, but had to pay for the internet password. Laundry service was rediculously overpriced and when I asked for help on a local service, they played ignornant. The staff was a bit slow and not very helpful. The rooms were nothing to write home about.

Reviews.Title: “Poor hotel - location good”
Reviews.Author: ETbrisvegas
