Reviews.Content: Checked into a room that badly needed refurbishment!!! Not very clean and nothing like website. Did not have breakfast or eat in hotel so cannot comment. Staff not very friendly, especially the male staff - female were nicer. Neither were very helpful or go out of their way. The only redeaming feature is its location, which is great - close to public transport, markets, Arab street and hospital (if needed). Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good...”
Reviews.Author: MelissaSue358
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was great value for money. We thought that the staff were very friendly and helpful. Especially the lobby staff, always very helpful with directions to places that we needed to go. The location is great and is only two streets away from MRT and Bugis Street. I particularly liked being able to open the window and take in the sights, sounds and smells of Singapore in the Arab quarter. The rooms are not that clean, but the hotel is old, it was pretty good to my standard and I am the bleaching queen. Two bottles of water were placed in the room each morning, and the room was cleaned each day. The pool is beautiful to swim in, and the pool staff were very friendly. There are two restaurants in the hotel and both catered a great selection for breakfast at quite a reasonable price. There is free internet available in the reception area. There is a beauty salon to the left of the entrance that is run by a Chinese lady, with limited English, I spent two hours with her and felt fantastic afterwards. There is a great shopping centre on the second floor catering to most of your needs. I think this hotel was fantastic for the money and the staff were very helpful to me, my lover and our young son. My son did get a bit freaked out with the attention that he received. There is a seven eleven directly across the road that also caters for most of your needs. The egyptian/turkish restaurant across the road I would have to say is the best restaurant that I have been to. I loved the culture of this place, I loved the smells, the sounds, and the people. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor room quality, unfriendly staff, water dripping in room from ceiling”
Reviews.Author: Aashish_BLR
Reviews.Content: I booked executive club room of this hotel. Room & Hotel pictures on internet indicate a good quality property. But in reality, the rooms are very poorly kept, walls are cracked, and dirty. I woke up early morning, not from my alarm clock, but from the dripping water from the ceiling. Upon complaining to the staff, they told me that I should keep the room extra cold, and set AC temperature to 16 degree C, otherwise this problem will continue, and there is no solution for it. They even declined to change my room. The staff was rude, and did not have any sense of courtesy. Breakfast quality, and ambience was horrible. The plates and other utensils were un-hygenic. I would never stay again. There is lot more Singapore has to offer, at this price. The wifi internet was damn slow. It took me 15 min to open my hotmail inbox.

Reviews.Title: “Every thing is old rag and smelly”
Reviews.Author: truthtelleroftravel
Reviews.Content: non assisting staff, rag bed, dump old bathroom, in the middle of wholesale market, hard to find a taxi hard for taxis to find

Reviews.Title: “A place to stay for F1 GP”
Reviews.Author: BLUGREEN_AUS
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a mate in a twin room as our accommodation at friends fell through only 2 weeks to arriving for the F1 GP. I hunted on Hotels.com and due to the late time frame we had limited options at a reasonable rate. I read the reviews and they were good and bad. I spend 6 months a year in 5 star hotels in Australia so I wasn't expecting too much. Our room was a Deluxe and the hotel placed us on the 14th floor. We were very suprised to find the room spacious, clean and all around very acceptable. I also read reports of exess noise from outside but I must say that once the window was closed (i love the fact that we could actually open one) the room was silent and the drapes blacked the room out completely. The single (we had a twin room) bed I had was extremely comfortable. We did find that the controls for the aircon were not very responsive and the room was cold but with the window open it was almost perfect and at night with the window closed it meant that it was comfortable once tucked under the quilt. The pool area was fantastic, a little tired but all in all very pleasant and the food and drinks around the bar were fine. Taxi's are cheap in Singapore and a cab was about $5 from the F1 Circuit to the hotel. All in all I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “over priced and run down hotel smelly”
Reviews.Author: jpr2777
Reviews.Content: having arrived in Singapore my first journey was to find my hotel. The interior of the hotel was run down, smelly and old. Not worth the money to be honest. i would rate this 1 star. The staff was not very helpful and just young novices.

Reviews.Title: “good location and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: oldsport79
Reviews.Content: we stayed in a club room on the 17th floor with lounge access and free wifi for one night before returning back to europe. usually I don't like to stay in rooms with lounge access (free drinks between 6-8 in the evening) when doing leisure trips but as the alcohol is quite expensive in singapore it was nice to have a couple of "free" drinks. the club room was fairly cheap and it's always nice when the wifi is included. rooms were great the only thing I didn't like was that they had a shower curtain in the bathroom, I prefer a glass door or something similar. the shower curtains always feel dirty.

Reviews.Title: “unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: rgh1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and three days. two main problems we faced were the reception desk staff were unfriendly and needed to be reminded to be polite. secondly, the rooms have no ban on smoking.... so the air feom the airconditioner smells strongly of tobacco

Reviews.Title: “A very bad choice”
Reviews.Author: bobby281
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel through agent it was suddenly planned and we booked it and what a mistake I made. I requested for double bed however it was not considered and was offered a twin bed room. The rooms at the hotel are very old, they really need refurbishment, the bathtub was so damaged ( scratched ), the tv was very old and the remote didnt work. They made the wifi a business as we pay US $ 150 for the room its not given free of charge and all we get is this dirty old room. The air conditioner didnt have any control we couldnt reduce the air con and was freezing inside the room at night. I couldnt wait for the two days and spent most of the time out in the city to avoid staying in the room, was only there to sleep. After checking out I felt very relived....

Reviews.Title: “Felt Robbed and Insulted”
Reviews.Author: JoeEire
Reviews.Content: I have no Clue what hotel these people stayed in but it could not have been the Golden Landmark (or Landmark Village hotel as it is now called). The Hotel is on Arab street and the only things that I can say that was positive about the hotel is the view which is Nice and the staff where Courteous but I wouldn't say friendly. A Friendly person wouldn't let you stay in dirty, run down, exposed wired room like I stayed in. I could complain to no end about this Hotel so here is the list of problems Stained Carpets Stained Sheets Mucus on the bedroom wall from previous guest (in protest no doubt) Exposed wires (TV and Lamp) Bathroom fittings where broken and falling off Even the countertops and sinks in the bathrooms where obviously dirty not even dusted. Worst has to be the windows which were not correct for a multi storied building and could be a serious death trap for anyone who might accidently lean against window while looking out. I changed rooms three times complaining about legitimate problems. I only stayed because I had just gotten off a 16 flight from Ireland and had already paid Via Mastercard so the chance of not being charged anyway where slim. I was given a Courteous reply which was to have the room changed once then upgraded to a premium room. I had the same problems with the premium room. Dirty floor dusty table the most amasing thing was the bathroom was smaller and in just as bad a condition. For this shameful hotel and the privilege of staying I was charged over a hundred euro a night and I truly feel robbed. Beware anyone thinking of staying in this Hotel. It is a Death Trap.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, best location”
Reviews.Author: Rakesh37
Reviews.Content: Well, I choose this hotel because 70% of the reviewers have marked it as good. Let me cover each n every aspect in detail. Location: No match, it is THE best, next to Bugis MRT (300 meters) which is directly connected to Changi airport. Last MRT leaves from Changi just before midnight and from Bugis to Changi airport, the last is at 1129 while first is at 0605am. Hardly 45 minutes. Bugis street and Bugis junction, the fav hotspots for cheap shopping are just 400 meters away. Orchard street/ Marina bay is just 10 minutes away. Rooms: I happen to stay on 13th fllor with pool/ bay view (twin beds) and 15th floor (king size bed) with city view. Later room was big but again my personal choice, go in for pool/ bay view. Interconnected rooms are available but those make noise at night :), pls be aware not to give hints to your neighbour. Wifi access available at S$5 for 30 minutes. The Hotel: Well, it will be wrong to stay that it is a hotel because it seems more like a self serviced apartment where you check in and forget you are staying in hotel because you cannot command service. It is a pure 3 star hotel with swimming pool and gym as add on available with your room Service: "Dont expect anything". Well, I booked a king size but told upon checking that only twin beds are available. Dey did joined the bed but you know the diff betwene the two beds keeps you uncomfortable. However next day they shifted me to a room with king size bed. Almost 5-6 times, I would have called up housekeeping or reception but no one picks up the phone esp during morning hours. If they do pick up, dont expect them to react. I asked them to refill tea bags and reminded almost 3 times every 30 minutes but no one turned up. Even called up duty manager (well hard to call him, u hv to find him) but no action. They refilled it at their own convenience when I was out and usual housekeeping person came to clean my room. Carpet is age old and they still have CTV in the rooms :(. No microwave in the room. Out of my total stay of 3 nights, I got newspaper only two times. Word of caution: Housekeeping incl laundry people have dis habit that they will ring the door bell and use the master key to force open the door. So, if you are the one who has habit of moving in the room with clothes off or dont want to get embarassed being a victim, better put "Do not disturb" signage at the door and dont forget to put in the latch which can be only opened from inside. Check out took 30 minutes :( Summary: With the kind of service it provides at S$210/day (what I paid for room only wid tax), I think there must be better hotels elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “near Little India”
Reviews.Author: puneet0031
Reviews.Content: we just chose this hotel beacuse it was near to little india, Mustafa and orchid road, my travel agent told me that it is a 4 star hotel at very cheap price, but i would say it is a 3 star but at very high prices... advantages of this hotel: - near to shopping centes and little india - mrt station is nearby - taxi is easily available - can stay there if not with family disadvantages - staff was not good nor breakfast - very rigid on checkout time - room was not comfortable as we were told. rather can get better rooms at better prices on same location

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel if you are targeting shooping in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: mitesh90
Reviews.Content: Good food quality Amazing view from higher floors Good Swimming pool Very close to Orchid Road and Mustafa Shopping Mall

Reviews.Title: “centrally located next to Bugis MRT”
Reviews.Author: travel_doc67
Reviews.Content: good hotel and really close to Bugis MRT so travel is very easy to and from the hotel.staff ver very nice but sevice was very slow. cheaking inn too took long time.breakfast was excellant including the indian food was very tasty.nice pool and view.resonable room rates too.Stay here if you want centrally located hotel & if you r Not fussy about service.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: Visitor123Frankfurt
Reviews.Content: I had been at the Golden Landmark (or Village Landmark, as it is called now) a few years ago, and there was water dropping from the cealing in the breakfast room into my coffee. This time around, my preferred hotels in Singapore were fully booked, so I decided to give this hotel a second chance. I assumed that after such a long time the problem(s) should have been fixed. Wrong! To be fair, there was nothing dropping, but the cealing clearly looked wet. The first several plates were dirty when I took them, when I pointed it out to the staff, they only removed the one's singled out but did not care to check, if there were more dirty plates (there were!). The cereals were clotted, when I mentioned it the reply was "it is because of the way they are stored" (meaning they regarded this state as normal, and did not want to do anything about it!). The room was clearly not properly cleaned, especially the bathroom. The door of the wardrobe was broken, as was the step of the bathroom. Etc., etc. etc.. And the overall impression was: Staff is demotivated to the point they do not care.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value; Friendly and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: GatorDavid
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel June 22-27, 2010 and was very pleased with the location, accommodations, and service from the excellent, friendly staff. The room was good size and free bottled water was provided along with various toiletries. Although there is a charge for in-room Internet service, the Internet Kiosk in lobby allowed me to check e-mails several times a day for free. Only a block from the MRT (subway), Bugis outdoor market, and Sultan's Golden Mosque, it is located in the Arab district and allowed me to immerse myself in the local culture. It is also within 15 minutes walking distance of the Suntec Center where my conference was held. The pool, deck, and lounge on third floor are beautiful and well-maintained. In addition to holding my bags for 8 hours until my plane departed, I checked-in early and checked-out late with no difficulty. Could not ask for a better value and was thoroughly pleased with all aspects of my stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel with very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: adi567
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at this hotel in June. Almost everything was great - you can take the MRT from Changi airport to Bugis station and the hotel is just 200 odd meters from the station. Less than 4 minutes walk. Bugis street is nearby, which is a street shopping place, nice for buying souvenirs, etc, but possibly avoided for everything else. nice Iluma mall closeby. + Hotel room was clean and bathroom was clean too. + Bed was king size as promised and as seen on web site pics + The staff was helpful and so was the tourist counter lady in the lobby. + Nice swimming pool, from the looks of it, though we didnt use it. + Getting to Orchard, Harborfront, Flyer was easy by MRT/taxi I had stayed here about 10 years back on my first visit to Singapore, and the nice memories from that time were reinforced. Here are some things I didnt like - some reviews had suggested that i should ask for a higher floor. The hotel is charging 30$ per person for higher floors. this was not evident before. I had called the hotel and they had said all rooms are refurbished. This isnt the case, it seems. However, the room we got met all our expectations, so treat this just as advance information. - website proclaims free service to resort world sentosa. When i tried to book it, they said they had only 6 seats per day per shuttle. obviously this came as a surprise. I felt that the website statement is misleading. Anyone travelling in a group of 3-4 people has hardly a chance to avail this service, specially on late check ins, since the hotel also didnt book this in advance on phone. Overall, the stay was everything we had bargained for and more. Room size was huge and we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view”
Reviews.Author: Maneesh13
Reviews.Content: Hello The hotel is located at victoria street which at walking distance of MRT station. The morning buffet was very good. The rooms were spacious & comfertable. the view from our room was amazing & I could see magnificent suntech towers from my room. There are lots of activiies of flea markets nearby. The hotel itself has one shopping mall too .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: g5llchen
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night on the Executive floor on June 18. The location is excellent, just a block from the MRT station. The room has a fantastic view (see the attached pic)! The bed was comfortable. The room is clean. It even has a big Sharp LCD TV in the room. It's well deserve a 4 star rating! Will definitely come back!! The only thing was the wait on line for checking in and checking out were both very long. That's the only complaint I have.

Reviews.Title: “Landmark Village: Typical Tourist Hotel”
Reviews.Author: my_traveler
Reviews.Content: INTRO: The Golden Landmark hotel, recently renamed the Landmark Village hotel, is an OK place to stay for a couple of days, especially if you are in Singapore for sightseeing and shopping. The hotel is frequented by tourists from around the world, especially from India. The reception area looks impressive so does the hotel itself from the outside. ----------------------------- SERVICE: C. My room was always made up relatively late, i.e., in the afternoon, usually past 4 PM. So when I got back to my hotel room at 3 PM one day I found that the cleaning personnel had not yet cleaned my room. I also had a problem with the shower which only had cold water running. I told front desk about this problem on Sunday morning but by Sunday afternoon, when I got back, nothing was done. So I complained to one of the cleaning ladies that I saw on the hotel floor and she promised to get someone from housekeeping to fix the problem. Some minutes later actually someone came but he was unable to fix the shower. He said he needed to call a plumber but he would only come the next day, since it was impossible to get one on a Sunday afternoon. Anyway, the next day the problem was fixed. ------------------------------ ROOMS: B+. Relatively large rooms for a city hotel, enough space in my opinion. The bed was comfortable. Overall it was a clean looking room, possibly recently refurbished. You can have relatively fast Wifi access in your room. You have to buy a ticket at reception. I forgot how much it exactly cost but I do remember that it was expensive. ------------------------------- SWIMMING POOL: B. Seems, not many people use it. The pool bar was open from afternoon onwards. I am not sure, if they clean the pool every day. The pool chairs were not too comfortable in my opinion. ------------------------------ BREAKFAST: C. There are two breakfast restaurants: One for Indian breakfast and one where you get standard Western breakfast. I only ate once at the breakfast room for Western food and unfortunately the food wasn’t very good, the friendliness of the service personnel was so so and it was also too expensive (forgot the exact amount). After that bad experience I went for breakfast to one of the local eating places nearby. There’s a hospital around the corner with a great cafeteria. I know, this doesn’t sound too inviting but it actually was a great place! Apart from some medical personnel that were there too it didn’t have the feel of a hospital restaurant at all! Try it! -------------------------------- LOCATION: A-. Very good because it was just one block away from Bugis MRT (subway) station with a line that runs directly to the airport and the city center. So in essence you are just a 5 minute ride away from the shopping and entertainment zones of Singapore. Also, the hotel is located close to the nice Arab quarter with shops and restaurants. --------------------------------- TO SUM IT UP: I would grade it as a C+ hotel. It is a typical three star tourist hotel. Don’t expect too much in terms of service. It is a good place if you want to explore Singapore for a couple of days. Would I stay there again? If I could find a very good (!) deal on the internet: maybe, but I would certainly look for better alternatives as well although I know it is difficult to find a good hotel at a reasonable price in this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Great View and Service at the Executive Floor”
Reviews.Author: NamSheeTsim
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 days at the executive floor subscribed as a promotion package with complimentary airport transfers. The room is really VERY big. The furnitures are a bit old (sofa and table in the sitting room are of old style), but in good condition and clean. Bed is very big and very comfortable. There are internet connections in both the bedroom and the sitting room, transmission is fast. I moved from the Swissotel the Stamford to this hotel, the initial intention was for cheaper accommodation during my stay in Singapore. The feeling is entirely different from the two hotels. Swissotel is very busy (and more expansive), that giant building depends on ultra-fast lifts to transport guests vertically, the surrounding malls are flooded with people and there is an underground station just next to the hotel, gave the feeling of too much like home, but very convenient, especially if one need to go to the Suntec Convention Centre. I walked from Swissotel to the Village Landmark Hotel (previously called Golden Landmark Hotel) along the North Bridge Road in a late afternoon, made me feel more like a tourist. The transition from Buggis Street area to the Village Landmark Hotel is especially interesting. There are some very colonial building near the Raffles Hotel, then some local buildings, then the Buggis Shopping Mall, after a short section of construction, everything quieted down along the Raffles Hospital, then arrived the Little India and the Arab Street area. The tone changed significantly, with the Mosque and the very local shops along the Arab Street sharply contrasting the modern development of Singapore. The reception at Village Landmark is manned with limited number of staff, timing for check-out is important if one is in a hurry to the airport. We needed to take the 8 am flight and had to depart the hotel at around 5:30. The complimentary van transport was well arranged. The lounge staff (Mr. Adam) at the executive level knew about our plan and he voluntarily offered to arrange some packed breakfast for us! The view from my room in Landmark Village was towards the sea, the green patch of meadow and the orange rooftops at the Little India area with the busy roads far away gave a quieter picture than the view I got from the Swissotel, which was very busy with all the cars and highways close to the Cultural Centre though the view of the new Sands Casino was very impressive especially at night and the Merlion was actually in view. But we could see the Skywheel from the Landmark Village and the Parkview Square's spectacular architecture - reminded me of the film 'Star War'. We have breakfast at the executive lounge at the same level for breakfast. Very quite and comfortable. Choice of food may be less than that served at the American Breakfast floor, but we liked the quietness at the lounge, and they serve Nepresso coffee! Probably a great proportion of guests are Indians thus there is the Indian Breakfast served at another floor. From 6 pm to 8 pm free drinks and snacks are offered at the executive lounge to executive floor guests and we enjoyed some very good unwinding before going out for dinner. The beer glasses are also chilled in the fridge. I was a bit worried about the water pressure and water temperature for bathing as revealed by earlier discussants in this link. But both are very good in my room. We have not tried the swimming pool nor the restaurant. Overall our stay in the Landmark Village was very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to enjoy the sights and sounds of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: savethetigerkol
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Landmark Singapore on a five day trip with my family which includes my spouse and my two teenaged daughters . The hotel is very centrally located with shopping complexes as well eating joints all located within walking distance . Another convenient thing is that it is a pick up point for Singapore tourist operators for the sightseeing trips . The only downturn is that the food is highly overpriced and I would recommend the small but cozy eating places within a stone's throw from the hotel . Recommended for families as well as extended families travelling in groups .

Reviews.Title: “ok for stopover to see singapore”
Reviews.Author: takama
Reviews.Content: good location near bugis mrt. ok rooms, poor quality of toileteries, average service. good food at the indian restaurant. too less staff for too many rooms.p.s. the travel shop near the reception counter is a gem, helpful ladies. the reception staff were polite.

Reviews.Title: “a good hotel to stay with mustafa shopping centre within ten minutes”
Reviews.Author: travelfreak7777
Reviews.Content: The room was very spacious. The location was good with shopping centers nearby. The view from the room was good. The bathroom was excellent. As we went on a package tour, we got good food provided by the tour agents within the hotel. Even otherwise, I think there is not much to worry about food quality as they have very strict rules. The thing I didn't like was the elevator mechanism which always seamed to cross my floor. It took a long time for the elevator to arrive which was very frustrating. Across the road, you can recharge your mobile, get sim cards (you need a valid passport). Things are located at a nearby distance and the famous Mustafa shopping center takes about 10 minutes to walk.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for the price range”
Reviews.Author: waynekorea
Reviews.Content: the good points of this hotel are 1) proximity to the subway. Just a short walk away connecting you with the rest of the city 2) the proximity to Arab street and the interesting shops and restaurants there 3) the hotel rooms we booked were clean, quiet and comfortable 4) the staff were polite friendly and helpful the bad points 1) the wifi is expensive 2) the gym was not really available as advertised. It is well equiped, but no lights..after having 2 staff members try and help me for half an hour I finally gave up. could just be a minor problem 3) no hairdryer in the room 4) The buffet breakfast was not amazing but reasonably priced The good points outweighed the bad points and we were all happy with our stay. For Singapore it was a reasonable price and a pleasant experience, but not really a memorable one. would be happy to recommend it though.

Reviews.Title: “Three Stars at Best....”
Reviews.Author: Novellus
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I recently stayed at the Landmark Village Hotel for two weeks, in May 2010. We were located on the 17th, and 18th floors (19 floors total)... and for most parts all renovation work has been completed.. While we were there, they were painting the stairwells, so when they painted those on or levels, the area smelled badly for a couple of days. But that faded. Location IS this hotel's best attribute... Less than 2 blocks from the Bugis train station, getting there is a short and easy walk even when carrying heavy items. It's also close to some majir shopping centers, and close to Bugis Village. It's also acrosst the street from the Sultan Mosque, which is a real hub of activity, and an archictectural beauty. It's close to Little India, and the Arab sector. Again.. Location IS this hotel's best attribute... The area nearby is extremely safe... Be prepared.. the Mall located on the first few floors of this building are NOT for shopping... There are an inordinate number of travel agents located there, but otherwise, most shops are non-descript, open by appointment only, geared to selling mostly to the Indian visitors... it is not a place where you'll spend a lot of time at.. it's vacant, and one quick walk through is all you'll ever spend there. As for the hotel itself. Clean.. yes.. relatively quiet... rooms are a bit small... TV.. few channels... The 18th floor housekeeping staff is GREAT.. The restaurants downstairs (3rd floor and 5th floor) are nice, but nothing special. Extremely expensive to eat at... and the food is not that great... nothing special.. I can't immagine anyone walking in off the street, and eating there... It really is geaed to the hotel customer, who is traveling on an expense account. The front desk personnel seem to want to be helpful, but are also limited in what they can do.. they are always short staffed, so expect long waits there. Hot water to the room is always questionable... You cannot take a shower - long or short, without having the water temperature fluctuate... that is one constant.. 1 minute or 20 minutes... water temperature is always all over the place. You have no control. Room air conditioning.. there is no middle ground... too cold, or too hot.... we were never an\ble to set the thermostat to a nice temperature, and maintain the temperature.. so it was too cold all the time.... The pool on the 5th floor is nice enough. There is often some celebration of some sort there that uses the immediate area.. so we found the we were restricted from using it when we wanted to use it. Mornings is usually available, but not evenings... The 5th floor is constantly used by Indian groups.. There is a KTV lounge on the 3rd floor, but beer there is very expensive at S$10.00 per glass... that is uncalled for... The Asian singers are pretty and entertaining... but don't make up for the expensive prices. That's probably why the place is usually vacant. For our rooms, the Internet was free. Ask for it to be free if they try to charge you. It is wired, and somewhat slow. Ethernet cables are provided. You will need power adatpers if you are not from the region. S$2.00 is the most you should pay for this at local stores. There is underground parking. I did not use it. Overall, it's a 3 star hotel, in a 5 star city.

Reviews.Title: “if you can afford more, go elsewheres.......”
Reviews.Author: znetbabe
Reviews.Content: Staying in superior room, due to the price we sticked with it, but room is SO DIRTY, filthy carpet , everything fall apart, horrible TV - no kids TV stations, never seen anything like it for paying over $120 US a night, great room size, quite big for Singapore standard. We had a special deal w/free wifi, and use of swimming pool so can't beat that in Singapore. Wish I can afford more and stay nicer places...Location is the best, next to Raffles Hospital , Bugis Junction, Bugis Village, Illuma, Albert Court Hawker Ctr... I like this location over Orchard, more affordable and more feel of local places, one street over is Queens St where you can take Malaysia taxis and buses into Johor Bahru-if need to for Air Asia JB flights or elsewhere in Malaysia. Other hotels around Intercontinental, Ibis, Grand Pacific....

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Average service”
Reviews.Author: zainabns
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old and not very impressive over all. However it is very close to the Bugis MRT which makes it highly convenient (and cheap) to get to Orchard Road and around. Hotel service sucks! The front desk staff are particularly arrogant and border on being outright rude. We used an inhouse travel agent run by two old Chinese ladies, which was efficient and convenient. Would stay here only if I had absolutely no other choice.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service in Shades poolside. (Angry guest)”
Reviews.Author: jacqueline_woon
Reviews.Content: On 1st week of May, my spouse and myself were in pool area for some snacks item and drinks. i have been serve by a blackly staff with black t-shirt with NO name-tag on it. i can feel that, he is not willing to serve us anything, was rude when talking to my spouse and myself. When asking him on Indian foods on the flip menu, he commented to us that this is what our hotel been serve. Both of us have NO CHOICE than we order an Chinese food menu. When the billing time, he came forward to ask us, pay cash or room? I was very up-set of the service that he provide to us and hope the Landmark Village Hotel (so call Far East Hotel) will teach this above staff that i mention how to serve a guests. I will aslo like to address that, why Landmark Village Hotel staff in poolside never wear NAME-TAG or UNIFORM? When i walking around the pool area, he was smoking behind the bar-area. He think himself is the owner or hotel bosses that he can just do anything he like. I'm really hope the Landmark Village Hotel Management will do something to this above staff that i have mention.

Reviews.Title: “A over the avareage hotel with good facilities”
Reviews.Author: bdatta1981
Reviews.Content: Pros: The best part of the hotel is its location. Its right in the heart of the city with a metro/subway station right at a stone's throw. The hotel is huge (13 floors with around 700 rooms) and looks grand from the outside. However, I found the room to be a bit small for the price charged by them. I paid around 950 S$ for 10 days which I found to be affordable. There is a swimming in the ground floor which was clean and well maintained. Cons: Although room service is available round the clock, but service quality isn't good. Any request takes a long time to get fuliflled so one needs to plan or place a request for the service accordingly. Next, the internet usage charges are very high. 10S$ for an hour. If you want to surf for less, one can easily go to the cafe just outside the hotel where the charge is just 3S$ an hour! Overall a good hotel to stay.

Reviews.Title: “My Honeymoon Trip”
Reviews.Author: bond007Hyderabad
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I've ever stayed at. Very well located, in the heart of Singapore, with almost everything located within 3-4 kms. Food quality is excellent and staff is very courteous and caring. One of the staff members took special care of our luggage as went to a 2 day cruise. Room are very spacious and room service is also very good. People planning to visit Singapore should prefer to stay at this place.

Reviews.Title: “Never never recommend this hotel to your friends”
Reviews.Author: windygoh
Reviews.Content: As a regular corporate customer, I was not allowed to check in once I failed to provide a deposit (credit card or payment) as a guarantee of payment. After some arguments, they decided to let me stay but with a stupid act which they clear out the minibar and blocked the phone from calling out. I felt so humiliated. Furthermore, the front desk officers are not friendly and very ineffient where they took 15 mins for guest check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Basic budget, but good location.”
Reviews.Author: chefcrsh
Reviews.Content: Worn down, and in some sort of staging style ongoing renovation, so construction noise during the day. But overall an OK place to stay if you plan to be out of the room and do not require any service. Self rating of 3 star seems quite a stretch to me, more like 1. Again nothing horrible, but run down and a out of shape. Great view of the nearby Mosque if you are lucky. Really hard matress.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: AussieOy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights. Took two rooms on 15th floor - rooms recently renovated, but halls and exterior still need work. Our room had a king sized bed (fabulous), new bathroom was cramped and a bit dark but clean, air conditioning working but couldn't be adjusted and room was just a little too warm, old TV but with cable, coffee/tea and hairdryer included. Kids had twin room with bigger b'room, including bath and new flat screen, and better air con. Both rooms had huge windows and fabulous views. Kids used and loved the pool. Breakfast was standard fare for these sorts of hotels in Asia - cereals, breads, pastries (not real good), fried stuff, noodles, eggs etc - best was omelette on demand, worse was unimaginative fruit selection. - would rate 6.5/10 considering price. There are some eateries across at the Raffles Hospital complex, but we ate in for the convenience. DIdn't try restaurant as there are so many eating options nearby. Staff friendly enough. BEST thing is location - walk to the Arab and Indian sections and Bugis St area - lots of eateries and enough shopping to suit my teen daughter without going overboard. Taxis are cheap and plentiful, with friendly drivers, and used them to get round everywhere. Late checkout (6 pm) cost S$70. Worse thing was the ridiculous prices for internet - if it was free this would be a perfect hotel and would definitely stay again! :D

Reviews.Title: “Great location, just needs a good tidy up”
Reviews.Author: aka_johnno
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Landmark Village with a friend for four nights. The hotel itself is quite a big complex with a shopping mall below the hotel and a connection across to the Raffles Hospital adjacent. The location is great as its a very short walk (about 100-200 metres) to the Bugis MRT and the Bugis markets and shopping areas. The room we got on level 14 had great views and had evidence of a minor renovation, however there were a few flaws such as cracks in the cieling, ants, and lack of continous hot water. If you get room service, try the cheeseburger, really really really good! The staff at reception had turbulent moods, some willing to help, some looking confused and some who just wanted us out of their way. The exterior is really dated, and all signage labels the hotel of the old name, Golden Landmark, so I reccomend, (and it worked easier this way), to just tell Taxi Drivers to take you to Golden Landmark hotel. If I was to go back to Singapore I doubt I'd stay at this hotel again unless they undertake a full renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore Hotel Golden Landmark”
Reviews.Author: ArchanaPune
Reviews.Content: Amidst the Skyscrapper buildings, Our hotel Golden landmark was standing 16storey high,big reception and a lovely dining place.Lovely decor and a centrally located,easily accessable close to the market place near boggies street. Lovely swimming pool adn pickup drop facilities.Good bed and breakfast arrangements and is affilieted with the singapore airlines. Freeked out starying on the 14th floor with great service and their friendly approach

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: JamesPlymouth
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in a good location, 100 meters to the MRT station and bus stops, 100 meters to the market at Bugis Junction and with in walking distance of Little India. We had a large clean room and bathroom fully equiped with everything we could need. The staff are very helpfull on reception and the coffee shop does a great breakfast at a good price. Have stayed before and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “World class”
Reviews.Author: nickgoel
Reviews.Content: I was in singapore with my friends at golden landmark. It was a very good experience to stay at this hotel. It is located at boogys very close to the metro station, little india & the big mustafa mall. I can label my stay as PERFECT and very pleasant. The hotel staff were courteous to guide us about the tourist attractions & the wild might life in singapore. Very good experience to stay at golden landmark

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: want_2_c_d_world
Reviews.Content: We spent only two days in Singapore and most of our time was spent touring. However I have no complaints about the hotel. The staff was very helpful they booked the Night Safari for us and we had a wonderful time. The rooms were clean with regular room service. We however did not get time to visit the swimming pool and fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Non professional Rude Staff, better for business visitors, not family!”
Reviews.Author: auraudaipur
Reviews.Content: This was my honeymoon trip, I booked this hotel throught an agent ( yatra), in a package, from website it looks a good peaceful hotel, but its not. I arrive early and requested early check in as we were tired, the person on front desk behaved as we are staying there as a complementary guest! he was talking in a very rude manner and we got our room after 7 hours, the waiting lobby looks like a crowded street market, open restaurant is just in front of lobby reception as it gives that crowd a edge of food smell. Rooms are average, Staff is non friendly, even we took our heavy luggage from room by our own no good luggage service available.

Reviews.Title: “Thin Wall, freezing aircon and slow-working hotel reception staff”
Reviews.Author: deedeex
Reviews.Content: Location of hotel is reasonably good, about 5 - 10 mins walk to Bugis MRT. Was there with partner for 4 nights, the room was terribly cold, the aircon was turned off and still it was ridiculously cold. The bed was hard, quite uncomfortable to lie on. Internet was not working on my laptop, though 'free' hardly can use it because of some server down etc, which was a huge disappointment. The hotel staff was almost unreachable by the phone in the room, had to put on hold for 15 mins just to speak to a human. Hotel staff was also not efficient, we requested for late checkout, they can tell us on last day that "oh, you can't, you would have to check out at 12pm", which I was very annoyed about. Only after insisting that we already requested for late checkout on Day 1, then the staff allow the late checkout. The worst thing was, the wall between the hallway and the next door was incredibly THIN, there were brunch of screaming kids next door that disrupted our sleep. Not to say incompetent parents who left their kids screaming and TV loud on. Over all, I won't ever go back there again. Rather you spend more money, get a more decent hotel with good room facilities, good customer service and thick walls for good night sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for Indians :)”
Reviews.Author: hm83
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights. Had a nice stay through-out. Excellent rooms, nice bed, very clean. Friendly-staff and the location is good as its near Little India. Plus we get the Tube train easily which is situated @ walking distance (Bugis Station).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, near little india”
Reviews.Author: Radhika7
Reviews.Content: Liked the hotel, especially the location. The food and service was also very good

Reviews.Title: “Confusing”
Reviews.Author: DKWorldtraveller
Reviews.Content: First it's important to know that this hotel is now the Village Landmark, though that name only appears on two small signs by the entrance. On maps and signs on the street and Bugis Street Station etc. it is still the Golden Landmark as it was known for years. Also the entrance is not on Victoria Street but on Arab Street around the corner. The management could do something to tell you this, but don't. Now I do. New name and management has not made it better. Rooms are OK, if small. Breakfast is short on fruit and vegetables, but heavy on fat and baked beans.Much like bed and breakfast in Brighton in the 50' ies, I think. It is not exactly bad, but I think you can find better in Singapore for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Old and worn”
Reviews.Author: malb1234
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 2 days at start of our trip charged $70 early check in rooms magically appeared after we payed the fee small bathroom stained carpets slow reception stayed 4 nights on our way back to NZ wet puddle on carpet for 4 days outside bathroom door had machine in hallway to take away smell of dampness Indian wedding 2 nights so had to vacate pool early by 5.30 pm nice restuarant good location

Reviews.Title: “Out of the city centre but convenient location...”
Reviews.Author: VIN55A
Reviews.Content: We booked a superior room (no breakfast) on www.hotels.com for $103 per night, which was cheap for Singapore. Upon check-in we got upgraded to a deluxe room (#204) much to our delight and found the room to have good views of the Singapore flyer (Asian version of the London Eye) and some harbour views. The room itself was quiet small but was clean, had a king-sized bed, fridge, coffee/tea making facilities and a decent baby cot that our baby actually slept in! The carpet in the room was a little stained, the exhaust in the bathroom didn't work and I thought the sliding door to the bathroom did not fit the decor of the room. However, the bathroom was clean, toiletries were provided and the shower was great. This hotel is very close to Bugis Station MRT which is a few stops (after an interchange at City Hall) from Orchard Road. Bugis Junction/Village and OG (cheap department-like store) was a very short walk away and even Suntec City wasn't too far either (10-15 minute walk). The hotel itself is on Arab street which has a lot of middle-eastern, malaysian and indian restaurants and influences. If you have an MRT close to your hotel, absolute everything and anything is within reach and this was one of the main reasons for choosing this hotel. The cost was also a big factor. Breakfast wasn't included in the price but places to eat in Singapore are endless, cheap varied and easily accessible. The hotel has a pool and from our window it looked big and clean. however, we never had the chance to try it out. I agree with some of the other reviews that the hotel itself needs to be revamped but it was a comfortable stay, convenient location and was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Singapore”
Reviews.Author: stutiagg
Reviews.Content: My stay at Singapore was fulfilling in way that i could explore each and very part of it.The hotel was great.The location of the hotel was right in the centre of the city.It was very near to the popular shopping complexes in Singapore.The food was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “ticks all the right boxes”
Reviews.Author: whrabbit
Reviews.Content: am puzzled by the conflicting reviews this hotel gets.my experience was flawless but maybe thats because i paid a minimul extra fee to web book a "club" room.singapore is an expensive city for accommodation yet this "club"floor room only cost S$ 210 total per night in xmas high season..the room with views to the singapore"wheel"and partial harbour views,had a comfortable mattress,frig,wall tv ,morning english newspaper and late check out till 4pm (a big plus if you have a midnight flight)club rooms-not available to anyone with children under 12-allowed key carded access to the club bar between 7am and 10.30pm where free breakfast was served and finger foods and drinks(including beer) were available on a self service basis.a free computer is also available.a member of the staff is also available for any information required... a 4 minute walk brings you to bus stop for bus to suntec city (bus 133 ;$1, travel time 10 minutes) and there is an independant travel agent on same floor as check in...both check in and check out were professionally handled...shared taxi from airport was $9 with a waiting time of only 10 minutes...i was able to book a 3 zoo tour(bird park,singapore zoo and night zoo -a long day and found the night zoo shows very commercial.would recommend leaving the night zoo after train ride(very poor reports from fellow passengers of optional dinner ) .thus cutting two hours off tour and .at own cost,either getting taxi or public bus back to city....

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Rinky23
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights/3 days in August 2008..The hotel has an excellent location...very close to bugis..the shopping hub..we loved the location..the metro station was a stone's throw away..so it was very convenient to access other parts of the city. The staff were very helpful..they helped us plan all our sightseeing activities...they also gave us a complementary ride for one hour on the hop on/hop off bus..on the first day..on the second day we visited Sentosa and loved that place...! The rooms very aveage and can be better..though quite clean..The breafkast spread was ok..not very lavish..and it was not included with the room..the food at the hotel is expensive..so we usually had our meals in the restaurants close by..Thai and Continental food..which was quite nice! Overall our experience in the hotel was good,,,!

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: chenbear
Reviews.Content: It is an old hotel that looks worn. The location is okay. The room was small. I am not sure why anyone would choose beige carpet in a hotel... The carpets were very stained and grungy, but the carpets are beige, the furnishing old and the wear was apparent. This hotel really needs upgrades and renovation. There was a wedding at the pool one night while I was there. The wedding started early was very loud and went late and I was in a room over looking the pool. When I needed an iron, I tried phoning the front desk and housekeeping to ask for an iron, finally reaching them they told me to come down and get an iron after an interesting conversation they brought the iron to me. Upon departing the hotel I left a bag of adapters at the hotel after calling an emailing for two weeks I was told they do not have the adapters.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location and comfortable stay at Golden Landmark”
Reviews.Author: Aisquash
Reviews.Content: Golden Landmark Hotel is located at walking distance from Bugis station, so for those using the Singapore's trains for commuting will find this hotel conveniently located. It is in proximity to shopping centres like Golden Mile Complex. For a mid size budget, this is a comfortable hotel with well appointed rooms. There is a good view from some of the rooms, so those desiring a view of the city should select their room accordingly. The buffet breakfast with B&B is nothing to write home about, and I consider this to be a downside. There is a variety of restaurants around the hotel. While those looking for luxury may prefer other hotels in the viscinity, those on a budget should this hotel a try.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DDDD4
Reviews.Content: Golden Landmark is a wonderful hotel. It is also centrally located and there is good shopping and restaurants around as well. The room was nice and spacious. Got a chance to use the swimming pool as well which was quite unique as well. Tried out a local dish at the hotel restaurant which was also very good. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: nondenom
Reviews.Content: the lobby is really shabby. So are the passages outside the rooms. the rooms are decent enough, but not really worth the approx 180 dollars i paid. just goes to remind you how expensive hotels are in singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Unsatisfactory!”
Reviews.Author: travelgirlVJT
Reviews.Content: I do not recommend this place, especially for business travelers. My room had no iron or ironing board, no hair dryer, and no clock! The carpets were very stained and grungy. Bed skirts were also stained. My bed was rock hard. Bathroom was in poor condition. I tried phoning front desk and housekeeping to ask for an iron, and no one answered the phone, instead i had to go back downstairs. Lobby and pool area were nice, but not worth staying here. This hotel really needs upgrades and renovation.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't let my dog stay there”
Reviews.Author: The_cruise_couple
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were booked into the Golden Landmark hotel for one night after our cruise. We were looking forward to seeing the sights and relaxing in what we were told was a 4 star hotel. Where do I start! We arrived at 10.30 and were told we couldn't check in until 2pm. a room had been set aside for us to store our luggage. We went out to explore and returned around 1.30pm when rooms were being allocated. We had specifically asked for a low floor and non-smoking, we were given a smoking room on the 12th floor! The room was a nightmare! the bathroom was dirty. There was mould around the bath and the tiles which were also broken. The bottom of the bath was very dirty. On lifting the toilet seat I found it had not been cleaned properly for some time and was badly stained. The shower head leaked so much there was hardly any water coming out of it as it all ran down the hose. The carpets were disgusting! You would not want to walk barefoot in case you contracted a disease. The bed linen was very clean but the beds were as hard as concrete. There were also small bugs running all over the place - including the bathroom. During the evening there was an Indian birthday party taking place by the hotel pool. It was absolutely stunning to see but the music and noise was so loud the floor was shaking. I tried for over 30 miutes to contact reception with no luck so had to go down to find out when the noise would stop. The receptioinst apologised and said it would finish at 11pm sharp, and it did. We went down for breakfast in the morning and wished we hadn't! It was awful. The room was so small and cramped and the table was dirty from the previous guests. The food looked and tasted awful and you had to cook your own toast. The only good point was the pool and surrounding area, but we waited over 30 mins to get any service! I would not even give this place 2 stars and if we were staying any longer I would have asked for another hotel. This place is'nt even fit for a dog! We were lucky we only had to spend one night there!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay!!”
Reviews.Author: nonhorva
Reviews.Content: A nice and pleasant stay near Bugis Junction MRT Station. Getting there by Taxi can be quite tricky as a lot of the streets leading to the hotel are one way streets. Traffic around the hotel at times can be extremely busy. Alternatively you can catch the MRT to Bugis and just walk. Its around 5-10 minutes walk, although if you have a lot of luggage it may be best if you just catch a taxi. The staff are quite friendly and helpful. The building itself is quite old, but it has been nicely renovated. We stayed in the superior room on the 16th floor. Great views and quite a large room with a king size bed, flat-screen TV and clean appearance. This hotel is also one of the few hotels remaining in Singapore that still offers smoking rooms (so for smokers, this is good news for you). Although saying this, the ventilation in the room is not too good as you cannot open the windows. The bathroom is quite old looking but clean. Internet is available at the hotel, but quite expensive. Unless you have internet already included in your price. The hotel also has swimming pool and gym on level 5. There is a 7/11 just across the road if you don't want to consume the overpriced drinks in the minibar. Bugis Junction is the closet shopping center. For lovers of electronics Sim Lim square is a 10 minute walk away. (But beware, there are many sharks at Sim Lim Square, so do your research first before buying as there can be very pushy sales people there). Please note: The hotel name has changed. It used to be called Golden Landmark Hotel (It still has this displayed on the building top). Now it is called Village Landmark Hotel. These are the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very suprised”
Reviews.Author: pavmanmikey
Reviews.Content: I had a 2 night stay on the way back from UK to Hobart, I needed the break and had booked the hotel on-line not expecting anything too wonderful after reading the reviews. Staff were friendly and efficient my room was clean & serviced well, the loction was fantastic walking distance to MRT, Raffles & Bugis Junction(shops & food) I could not fault this hotel, mabey I was one of the lucky ones but i would not rule out on previous reviews, its certainly value for money, I only paid $AS70 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Try Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Notcomingback
Reviews.Content: As an earlier reviewer “Wallwork” wrote, don’t bother arriving early to this hotel as you won’t get a room. Indeed don’t bother arriving at 6pm in the evening as my colleague found his room was not available either! The check-in suffers from the “if I can get this guest off my case I’ll be off-duty in an hour and it will be someone else’s problem”. The facts: I arrived at 8:30am in the morning having requested an early check-in. The receptionist was only too happy to go through the check-in process including swiping my card for $50 for surety and then stares at me blankly as I wait for the room key. “Sir Check in time is 2pm!” After repeated attempts to check-in at 3pm they inform me my room of choice is not available. After much consternation I accept the alternate room only to find on entering the room that it was still in use! Another call to reception this time asking for the duty manager and I’m told that its my fault because the room is booked to 6pm...!!! My two colleagues arrive at different times in the day and had the same experience. Totally unacceptable. We all worked out individually that the only way to get service was to scream! Other problems with the hotel, very hard to access (located on the 3rd floor above a shopping mail.). Room were run down and generally in a poor state. Reception area was chaos at all times of the day. The hotel did eventually upgrade me to the executive level which included complimentary breakfast and evening drinks, but by this time we were all over it and ready to move on. Clearly other reviews have had similar problems and until management address the reception apathy I recommend you Try Elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Dave95
Reviews.Content: It's safe to say the hotel isn't centrally located or located in a 'happening' area, but it's only a 5 minute walk to Bugis junction where there are plenty of shops and lots of places to eat. There is an MRT station there as well. I had a room on the 15th floor and was able see half of the Singapore Flyer, which looked great lit up at night. The room I had was quite big. Very comfortable king size bed, TV, fridge, in room safe. There was wifi in the room, but it wasn't free. I also had 2 bottles of complimentary water every day.The people on the front desk were very helpful & friendly. A great stay and would certainly stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Not really what I expected for the price”
Reviews.Author: schoash
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 2 nights on our transfer from Malaysia back to Europe. The room had quite dated and partly destroyed furniture. The Queensize bed had only one bedstand, which was a bit strange. The bathroom was horrible. It was very small, the shower head was partly destroyed. When you flushed the toilet, the room floor was flooded. The sink was not working at first, which got fixed quite fast. The whole bathroom had a lot of different white tones painted over time on the walls. On the first morning we had a very strange smell like in a kitchen in the room. When we returned back from the city in the evening, the smell was still there. I decided to call for help. So at first came a guy who told me, that a woman with roomspray gonna come soon. She came and was spraying the room. I wanted to tell her, that the aircon must be causing the smell, but she didn't understand me, therefore she called the manager, which arrived 10 minutes later at the door. The manager suggested putting a aircleaner in the room, which was done 10 minutes later. After another hour, a guy came and took the weird machine, which didn't help at all away. I was tired complaining and gave up. There was wifi available but not for free. The pool hours were from 7a-7p which is a bit strange in my point of view. Since we returned around 11pm we couldn't use it. All in all I think that the room was not worth its price at all.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay in the city downtown”
Reviews.Author: GrifterParis
Reviews.Content: Great central location with walking acess to underground. Big rooms with a lovely view over the bazar and the mosque and good value for price. The only thing that was a bit confusing was the bagage storage if you come before check-in like i did. They offered to store it unil proper check-in time and they said that they would take care of it. When i return later on to check-in, receptionist told me that my bags were waiting into my room where they were not i found out. I called front desk and was told that they were going to be delivered soon so i waited but one hour and a half later, still no sign of my bags so i came down and enquired directly to the bagagerie people and there were my bags waiting for me.... Apart from that, my stay was fine but next time i will make sure not to come before check-in time and will not drop my bags.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but Hotel needs an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: barbourella
Reviews.Content: Great location, just a few minutes walk to Bugis Junction. The hotel is in desperate need of a refurbishment/upgrade and the two rooms we had were pretty dangerous in terms of electricals. We booked a superior room however there is only one grade of room. You can pay for an upgrade which is basically extras put into the room. The staff were helpful and pool area was great but hats about it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: nqnam_family
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good. Staffs are professionals and friendly. The location is very convinience, 5 min walk to Bugis MRT, a little further to Bugis Junction and street stalls. There are several food courts and hawkers centre within distance. The room is clean and good size. The pool is great with deck. It is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the Golden Landmark”
Reviews.Author: Wallwork
Reviews.Content: From start to finish I hated our visit to this hotel. The front desk staff went out of their way to be difficult and unpleasant. I arrived at the hotel at 8pm with my children after a long bus trip from Kuala Lumpur. We already had a booking and when I confirmed that we wanted a room with the benefits of the Executive Lounge I was refused. I explained that I wanted to pay extra for better rooms but I was refused again. When I pressed for an explanation I was told that children were not allowed into the Executive Lounge because children are loud, rude and misbehave. I found this rather insulting as I do try to bring up my children well! In fact the children were sitting quietly and patiently by the front desk. It took well over an hour to check in as the front desk wanted my husband to check in for me but as he was in a business meeting he was unavailable. The receptionist also initially refused my offer of my own passport or credit card details to help speed things up. When we were finally allocated our rooms they were dirty and stank of smoke. When I complained about the state of the rooms it took another long wait for us to be moved. I must emphasise that I was polite throughout but I cannot say the same for the staff who kept disappearing into a small room behind the front desk.The new rooms were not much better but at this point I just gave up. I could continue complaining - the squashed cockroach by the poolside, the surly porters and waiters. The next day the manager apologised - but sadly the hotel remained a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant obliging staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: travellers2or3
Reviews.Content: During our 2 day stopover in Singapore the hotel staff were friendly and helpful. They provided me with a wheelchair to assist me during my stay as I had my leg in plaster, and the room was prepared for us without extra charge well before the check in time which was a great relief after a long haul flight. Great location and good pool area to relax were added benefits to the stay.

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Belladonna72
Reviews.Content: Hotel Golden Landmark is a decent hotel with adequate service, especially the executive part we were in. Room is nothing special, but pretty large and it was cleaned daily. Hotel itself is close to the city center, but it is better to use metro, as the climate in Singapore is really hard to stand. Although close to the center the neighborhood is quite colorful and exotic, with lot of little shops in Arab street. Check in and out was smooth and fast. What we have liked most is executive club lounge, where we had breakfast and evening drinks and snacks. The service in it was really excellent. The food was all right, but the choice could be better. We did not have time to use the pool, but we had a drink once at the pool bar and it seemed ok. What we did not like are the elevators which were sometimes crowded and had a strange mode of working. It happened few times that we were driving for ten minutes in order to get from 17th to 18th floor or reverse. To conclude, hotel Golden Landmark is good place to stay if you are in town for a couple of days and choose an executive room.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for Singapore stop-over on way to Europe from Australia”
Reviews.Author: Ian_CSydney
Reviews.Content: We found the room to be modern, clean and comfortable. The staff were friendly and there weren't any problems with the internet booking. The hotel restaurant is reasonably priced for breakfast and the hotel is conveniently located to the MRT. The hotel has a very attractive outdoor pool area and sundeck. We would certainly stay again on our way to Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Try elsewere first”
Reviews.Author: wazzaLatrobevalley
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 8.00am told check in we knew we were early and had just come off a 14hr flight how long till room ready. Returned at 11.30am told the room was still occupied, asked again at 12.30pm and told people had a 6.00pm check out so would be after that. I then made noises about a refund and going to the Ibis ( cheaper ) and suprise they found a room but it was an up grade and we didnt have to pay extra, all they then had to do was find our details they lost it. Finally got our room, key didnt work again, again no toilet paper. but this time the air condition was set to freeze and could not be turned off, so we pulled the key from the door. and went with out power.

Reviews.Title: “Rude, non cooperattive Staff- They treat you as prisoners”
Reviews.Author: AamirS
Reviews.Content: I have had a very bad experience- when I entered the hotel- no reception on the ground floor- I felt as if am entering a shabby shopping mall. Reception is totally disorganized. Rooms are pathetic- small and stinky. The worst experience was when my credit card was charged though I had mad payment by cash upon check out and also paid some advance cash and again they insisted on punching my credit card- that they promised not to charge. I was shocked to see my statement back home after 15 days of my checkout form this hotel. I pleaded / shouted/ begged them to release my payment and It was after about 90 days of struggle that my payment was reversed. Friends please don't ever stay in this hotel- they overcharge, this is a pathetic budget hotel and not a 3 star and they treat guests like prisoners. ABOVE ALL THEY ARE CHEATERS.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel but service....”
Reviews.Author: mohitberiwala
Reviews.Content: Pros: Deluxe room simply awesome. We got a room on the 19th Floor & the view was simply breathtaking. Buffet breakfast was amazing & hats off. Cons: A little far from the main market area (Orchard Road) & frequent use of MRT / Bus is necessary. Room lighting not adequate. Staff extremely unfriendly & unresponsive. We had to call thrice before anyone picked up the phone also bell boys were extremely rude. If someone has to stay in the Bugis area, then only go for this hotel otherwise pick up another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Aman's stay at golden landmark”
Reviews.Author: arkitect_aman
Reviews.Content: AMAN DEEP PATIALA (INDIA) I stayed at golden landmark with my wife and son for 4-nights from 5th to 9th jun in room no.831 at 8th floor,with a nice city view We have memorable experience staying here .Very helpful staff ,great location ,5-minutes walk to Bugis junction to catch MRT,all popular malls like mustaffa and sim-lim are near by for electronic gadgets ,spacious room .crisp clean sheets,Accross the road is 7-eleven for basic needs,so purchase your cold drinks, chips,beers and load you mini bar .Break fast was included in our package which was so-so ,waiting for omlette was to much to skip it,every day same menu .Over all ambience needs upgradation, room toilets are very very small you have to rotate yourself and cannot move,the taps are quite oldish and take ages to flow water from taps, over all can be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Close to MRT”
Reviews.Author: Aussietriptraveller
Reviews.Content: We used the MRT to travel from the airport to the hotel. We found the rooms quite comfortable. The food at breakfast was not very appertising, but adequate. Internet access $S 5 per half hour. We had a late night flight and came back to stay by the pool for a while. The transit shower facilities were actually the poolside ones. These had no airconditioning and we were more uncomfortable after the shower than after a day walking in the heat. In future we will use the showers at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good location in area with flavour of old Singapore”
Reviews.Author: RTWer
Reviews.Content: Stay was just one night, stopping over on way to London. The hotel is above a local shopping centre typical of the 70's. The reception staff were polite and helpful, although they did try to give me the booking made by another person with the same name - make sure you check the paperwork! I'd booked the executive package, free internet, access to the club lounge on the top floor, room on 17th or 18th floor. A bit more expensive but worth the extra. The room was clean and large enough; decor was somewhat dated but pleasant enough. Location is on Arab St and close to Bugis - area still has examples of the old Singapore. Easy walk to Raffles and Raffles City, and to Suntec Plaza, and close to Bugis MRT. There's a very good local bar / restaurant just around the corner on the city side called the Blu Jaz cafe - good local food and beer.

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of other places to stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: lovechocolatecake
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in May. For the price we paid I thought we would have been in a deluxe room, but not so. We were shown to our standard room which was dull, chipped and scratched furniture, stained carpet, cracked and chipped tiles in bathroom and ?? mould growing in places. Not happy and asked for an upgrade/better room. We were told it would cost $30 per person per night to do this. Reluctantly we agreed to pay the extra and moved to a different room. It was better than the last but still not deluxe, definitely no more than 3 star. Ironically when talking to person on desk, we were told that if we had walked in off the street that night wanting a room we could have got it for $120!! (They had a special deal going for that night only). Location is reasonable. Very close to Arab Street which is very interesting and its worth looking at Lonely Planet and following their walking tour guide. Loved the area. Woken every morning around 5.30 a.m. by the "calling to prayer" from the mosque over the road but it didnt bother us as we had chosen to stay in this area. Found the shop vendors around Arab street to be very friendly and helpful and bought some lovely oilbased perfumes. Also make sure you check your room door is closed properly when you leave. We found the doors did not automatically close tight and you had to physically pull door shut before you left for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Holidays .. The Start”
Reviews.Author: mihirshah22
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good and decent. value for money . nice view and good breakfast. Good for Indians as many tours have their stay there. the hotel is also very near to the metro so easily accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Nice breakfast”
Reviews.Author: VJ26
Reviews.Content: I had stayed for 5 days in this Hotel and the rooms are alright. But the nice thing was the breakfast that was tasty with a variety of dishes. This place is close to Bugis Junction and we could shop well. There are other shopping centers nearby & a lot of restaurants nearby. The Hotel is ideally located for access to entertainment places.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant”
Reviews.Author: lakako
Reviews.Content: It was my mom 's birthday so we brother & sister wanted to give her gift of family reunion . we booked three rooms in this hotel.People at reception were nice & helpful.Rooms were clean with fresh linen & towels though little old but still well maintained and clean. Night time their lobby was little loud because of live singing bar in the complex. Five minutes walk form the railway station . over all average no regrets .

Reviews.Title: “chinese temple machow temple, buddist temple, mustafa, santoosa, and other site”
Reviews.Author: SARITASingapore
Reviews.Content: my short visit at Singapore, wonderful country. i like the country their culture, working, cooperation, shopping malls. i would like to give my services to this country. i like the arrangement of hotel services Golden Landmark, 390, victoria streeet, singapore. thanks to Singapore to make my trip so pleasant. thanks Maa Machow. Thanks to Buddha. i would like to go their again again again. SARITA KASHYAP [--]

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Dutch_Guy_F
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a short walk away from an MRT station and very close to Arab Street (many restaurants). I had a Deluxe King Beg High Floor room. Great view from this higher floor room. The room was large, comfortable, clean and quiet. Some of the building materials looked cheaper than in other hotels but everything was working. Breakfast is ok but the breakfast room looks a bit shabby (plastic sheets on breakfast tables, older furniture). Very friendly and helpful staff. Very good value for a Singapore hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: call_gaurav
Reviews.Content: The hotel is okay. the main problem is the location of their reception. It seems that you are living in a mall.

Reviews.Title: “Real Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: IndiaTravelInsight
Reviews.Content: This is a great "value for money" hotel. We stayed here with the kids for a week with the primary objective of touring Singapore's attractions. The hotel may not give you a five star feelilng but is clean & functional with large rooms, friendly staff and above all, is very well located close to Bugis MRT. Taxis are also easily available and to most central places, the fare is in single digit. The airport is also easily accessible from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel if you choose an executive room”
Reviews.Author: zeehan
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights here recently. Check-in very late at night was smooth and efficient. Room on executive floor was spacious, although dark, and the king bed was excellent. Why, oh why, don't they clean the stained carpets? Almost every review I read of the Golden Landmark mentions the stained carpets. Also choice of coffee and tea in the room are awful. Pool area is very nice. Executive Club Lounge breakfast was very good indeed, something different every day, and if desired, you could just keep eating! Staff in the Club Lounge were lovely, gracious and very helpful. Free internet use was also handy, there is only one computer, but we never had to wait to use it. Only complaint I would have is that it states that children under 16 are not allowed on the Executive floors, Levels 17-19, however there were noisy children staying on Level 18. This is misrepresentation on the part of the hotel and could be very serious if one wanted to pursue it.

Reviews.Title: “Fading Landmark”
Reviews.Author: DancingWind
Reviews.Content: I'd planned a day in Singapore for a business meeting in Apr 09, but the timing was such that I had to spend the night and was looking for an affordable hotel. I thought that would be a cinch since it's hard times for the tourism industry but getting good rates wasn't all that easy. The Golden Landmark is not such a prominent landmark any more and is built like the old Singapore hotels, compact, efficient use of space and business-like efficiency. While checking in in the afternoon, I learnt that there were many other bargain hunters in the queue ahead, so I actually needed to wait for a bit before my turn came. The overall look and feel was ok, I've seen better at that price, but the rooms were comfortable and neat. The carpeting in the passageway was ageing, but tolerable. There was no breakfast included in the price, which was a disappointment. Internet was an expensive add-on too at Sing $ 25 ++ for 24 hours. I didn't get time to use the gym, though I used the launderette - on my floor - convenient to use, since they did not provide an iron and ironing board in the room itself. Not much soul to the hotel, but if you're planning on spending most of your time out exploring the city or in meetings, maybe you can manage there. There are a couple of good restaurants across the road from the hotel, just in case you get hungry and are game for a meal outside. Checking out was easier and better than checking in, if that was a criterion to judge the stay. I didn't encounter any issues during my stay there, so do not want to be harsh on the hotel, just that I would probably not return there, if the decision is left to me. It is a free world, isn't it, even in Singapore?

Reviews.Title: “A little Dated but well located”
Reviews.Author: JGBBristol_UK
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at the GL on route from UK to Borneo? Have stayed in Singapore a number of times so looking for something reasonably priced in a good location. Lobby is quiet dated and our rooms a little dark. But rooms are clean, bed large and the pool area is nice too. Well located for Arab and Bugis Streets for food and shopping and handy for MRT and bus stops.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Sam0305
Reviews.Content: Golden landmark is a hotel well situated.. surrounded by shopping centres.. Taxi is very easily available even at the late hours at night.. The hotel is a typical business hotel with lots of Indian staying. The apearance of the Hotel from outside is not very pleasing, but the rooms were very good. We got our room on the 19th floor, we booked a standard room and we were upgraded without even asking to a superior room with a huge king size bed. The food was not very good. The hotel is surrounded with Money changers so exchanging forex or TC is very convinient. If you do not want to eat in the hotel you can step out and you will find indian and malay restaurants down the road. The room tariff was very reasonable, with free self laundry service. there had a laundry room were we could wash our clothes and press them if you wish to do by your own to save an extra buck.
