The hotel was very clear with their checkin and checkout timings, stretching it even by 1 hr was a problem to them.. The conceierge was very helping and they did all our sight seeing arrangements ...

Reviews.Title: “Neat enough close the Metro”
Reviews.Author: WildGoomba
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the F1 race in 2008, were pretty much left with no other choice for our budget, But it was quite a nice place and no compalins really. Stay here if you want to save money and use that for shopping :) Regards

Reviews.Title: “too clumsy”
Reviews.Author: gautamjain26
Reviews.Content: highly priced for a 3 star hotel, small romms,, crowded small lobby, rooms are good and clean, good restaurants

Reviews.Title: “A run on the mill hotel”
Reviews.Author: danprsd
Reviews.Content: Well this was supposed to be a romantic getaway but it started out on the wrong foot. I guess this hotel's reception takes pride in making you wait. We arrived around 3 Pm and werent cheked in until around 4:15. I guess that a lot of tour operators use this hotel. So they give preference to the various tourist groups by checking them in first followed by the individual bookings. The hotel though is located close to Bugis market and MRT which is really nice. Malls like BHK are close by. Even Sim Lim towers is a short walk away. The breakfast is ok but the breakfast place is too crowded. So its difficult to get a seat in the house. I Think you are btter off staying in the club roooms as they might be serving breakfast somewhere else. Best part is that some people are there eating breakfast in thier nighties and night gowns whihc is quite hilarious. Location wise is awesome, as it is close to the mosque on Arab street and around the hotels are a few good indian as well as muslim eateries - serving amazing Murtabak right round the corner from this hotel. Rooms are a bit dated; especially the bathroom. the fittings are old and the bath tub is decoloured. You can stay here if you like however look for deals elsewhere; you might just end up enjoying your stay more.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Place”
Reviews.Author: ranajitghanty
Reviews.Content: It was a business trip, but with my family. Our Company booked the Executive Room for us on the 17th Floor. The rooms are excellent - spot clean. Room decor, amenities, lighting, service was state of art. Inside the hotel we had shopping complex, amusement theatres, water bodies, coffee shops, travel advisory shops and other such recreational items. It was Christmas time and entire city of Singappre was decorated. The stay at this hotel is 100% safe. For the execute rooms, the Hotel offers complimentary Breakfast as well as evening snacks including drinks. We thoroughly enjoyed the evening snacks. The Hotel provide for India Cuisine at the 8th Floor. Swimming pool, massage centers, health spa, gym, business centers are available. The staffs are very very customer friendly. All of them wear a lovely smile on their face when they talk to customers. The Location of the Hotel is not in the posh areas of the city. However, Singapore being a small country it does not really matter even if you stay few KMs (6 KM) away from the city. The charges of the Hotel are on higher side. But it is certainly cheaper when compared to the other Hotels of Singapore located around Orchard Road. Note that you have to pay GST (goods and service tax) above the room rent. So, in India Rupees, it will come to almost Rs 10000 per night stay (net amount including GST) at Golden Landmark Suggestion: If you are going during Christmas or Chinese New Year, then you will have even more enjoyment in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality at Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Mohan_Prabhala
Reviews.Content: My stay in Golden Landmark was one of the most memorables. That was my first visit to Singapore and i had a great time enjoying the hospitality at Golden Landmark...Situated in the midst of the business area close to the Raffles hospital and at proximity to Little India, its one of the star rated hotels in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Greenyzoz
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Golden Landmark in Singapore on the 8th March at around 8pm. We were pleased to find that it was a very short walk from Bugis MRT (literally 2 minutes). The MRT is probably the best way to get around Singapore. We found it easy to use, quick and most importantly very cheap! The check in at the hotel was quite fast and the staff were very friendly. We had booked an Executive room as you get free drinks with this package, breakfast, a bigger room (as we had heard rooms were small in Singapore) and access to the Executive lounge. They stop serving drinks in the lounge around 9pm and on the first night we popped over at about 8.50pm and the lady at the bar was so friendly that she gave us 3 drinks each to keep us going! The hotel room in itself was really nice. It wasnt small at all (but maybe thats because we had an executive room). It had everything that we needed, they even provided Molten Brown toiletries in the bathroom and a hairdryer. A paper was delivered every morning and sometimes had a little piece of paper telling you what the weather was going to be like. If you had booked an executive room you get breakfast included in the price and you can choose whether you eat your breakfast in the executive lounge or the restaurant at the hotel. We chose the restaurant as we enjoyed it so much the first morning. There was a lot of choice - cereal, cakes, pastries, toast, rolls, cooked breakfast (eggs, bacon, sausages, hash browns, tomatoes, baked beans, mushrooms), fruit and even an omelette station where you chose what you wanted in your omelette and it was cooked there and then. The hotel was very clean, we were impressed with how clean Singapore is as a whole. The staff couldnt do enough for us and were always asking if we needed help with anything. We had to check out of the hotel by midday and our flight wasnt until 10pm that evening so we were a bit worried about our luggage but the hotel took it for us and put it in their luggage room for no extra charge. The location of the hotel is good as its right near the MRT. There is a market down the road from the hotel and also some eateries. You also have the usual McDonalds round the corner and a Burger King! Raffles Hotel isnt far and there are some museums and galleries to visit nearby. If we ever wanted to go anywhere though we used the MRT, i couldnt recommend it enough. If you buy a travel card for 30$ (about £15) you get $10 worth of travel and the card is worth $5 which you can get back when you are finished with it. The $10 of travel lasted us 2 full days and we went everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Great value; great location”
Reviews.Author: HowellerCornwall
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights end of March. Fantastic location. Room clean and spacious (14th floor) if lacking in storage. View from room tremendous. Pool and area around it clean and pretty with good sun loungers. Breakfast substantial with all tastes catered for. Friendly staff, though the reception could be better organised. Good beds with great pillows and mattresses - air con efficient and not too noisy. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel for it's location - on the edge of the arab quarter which you must explore - so interesting with it's shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “sorry about stubborn management staff”
Reviews.Author: MultiTraveller1
Reviews.Content: the hotel insisted rather inpolite to charge roughly 15 % more than my internet contract stated as final all included price and wanted to base it on a hillöarious €-SGD exchange rate. Making their own rules at checkout is no way to attract me as customer again. Btw, cleanliness of especially the bathroom needs a lot of improvement.

Reviews.Title: “A True Garbage Dump”
Reviews.Author: lovetofly380
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for two days while in Singapore. We paid Australian $140 for this dump!!!! I wish we had paid a little bit extra and stayed at a better hotel. The pics of this hotel and rooms are quite deceiving. We arrived at the hotel at 6:00pm local time and our room was still not ready. We were asked to return in 1 hour. We had paid for a deluxe non-smoking room. When we finally got to the room I was shocked at how poorly it was maintained. My first thoughts when booking this room was "how bad can a three star be in Singapore" a country known for it's cleanliness. However, Golden Landmark was worse than most two starts found in North America. The room smelled of cigarettes and the odour got worse when you turned the airconditioning on. The bed was equivalent to sleeping on a concrete floor, and the pillows were even worse. Although, the hotel is in a great location it is not worth the stay at Golden Landmark. What I did not know about Singapore was the fact that the hotels are cheaper closer to the airport and the train system in Singapor is quite efficient and always on time. The price to commute from the airport to the city is only $2 Singapore Dollars. Therefore, it is better to stay closer to the airport at a better hotel if you cannot afford anything in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Tak-Hongkong
Reviews.Content: SGD141 per night in Singapore is good offer, especially for its good location (next to Bugis MRT) and the big and renovated room (in 15th floor, non-smoking) The only problem I (and most customer) encountered is it takes long time for check-in and check out because you don't know where the queue is. Having said that, I think staff are good, just the queuing design is bad. Management should seriously consider to review queuing system, e.g. one queue for all (except Executive floor).

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stop here again”
Reviews.Author: rachscott1
Reviews.Content: We stopped here on our way back home from Australia for 3 nights - I did quite a bit of research and decided on Golden Landmark due to the rave reviews about the location, and it seemed a reasonable price. Upon checking in, everything was a bit unorganised and bizarre, after our cases were taken from us, we were told we must go and sit out by the pool until our room was ready - the pool area is the one nice part of the hotel! Upon managing to check in (about 3pm) the room was very dated and although was a non-smoking room, smelt very strongly of cigarettes. The bathroom was covered in mould, and the bed was like sleeping on a slab of concrete. Breakfast was truly awful - the food was disgusting, there was nowhere near enough seats for anyone, the staff were rude and although it was included in our room price, we chose not to eat there after the first morning! The whole hotel needs a facelift, and has a very strong indian influence. I stopped in Little India last time I visitied Singapore, but I would say this hotel has more of an Indian feel, and wasn't actually classed as being in the area. The hotel is quite close to the Burgis MRT, but not within walking distance of much else. Next time we come to Singapore, we will definetly spend that bit extra and go somewhere that we can be assured of a little more quality.

Reviews.Title: “Characterless but good”
Reviews.Author: NLR
Reviews.Content: I wanted a decent hotel in expensive Singapore. This fitted the bill. It is characterless but the reception staff are very friendly and the rooms are a decent size. it has a swimming pool which we never used due to time constraints. It is very well situated, close to a MRT station. It is actually on Arab Street where there are some excellent Middle Eastern restaurants, and there is a food centre across the road. There is plenty of shopping around. Their laundry service is expensive and we never tried their restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Good, satisfied”
Reviews.Author: anabellaff
Reviews.Content: the location is just perfect,just few steps away from bugis junction. rooms is good and clean. I didn't go for da swimming pool but it seemed nice. the price is vry fair because we have using the 2 nights delights, stay one night and free one night, it's only available for malaysian. Overall, GOOD.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: ABHISHEK1972
Reviews.Content: We had gone for a family vacation to Singapore and stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in last week of Oct'08. Entrance and reception was not very pleasing and we thought that we had made a mistake. Overall the Hotel has a worn out look. When we finally got to the room, we were pleasantly surprised as the room was big with a huge bed, where I could sleep comfortably with wife and a young kid. Rooms had all basic necessities and view from our room was also good. Best part of the hotel is their pool area and one could relax there and have a beer or cofee without much of disturbance. I liked this hotel due to its room and pool area besides we got this at a very cheap rate of SGD 130/Night. If you don't expect much, it is a nice property with good location.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel for Decent price”
Reviews.Author: vivek2512
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fairly ok for the price we paid.The best part was the location which has the proximity to almost all the major places like Little India,Mustafa, Arab Street,Bugis etc The rooms are very basic & small in size( though it was really neat & clean hotel, with good hospitable staff).The bathroom amenities are very basic and minimal. TV set needs to be changed from those old boxes to LCD or atleast smart flat screen TV's.( not much choice of the channel being displayed) Pool & the health club is good .Food was above average for the breakfast with good combination of Indian food( required in Singapore for the vegetarians like me). Overall and average stay without any complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Tired,old, lobby smells upon entering,restaurant was mediocre!”
Reviews.Author: MelPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: I booked thu an Asian hotel booking service. I got stuck in Bangkok during the Airport closure,had to travel from Thailand to Singapore by several busses over a 40 hour period. The hotel was infomed of my hardship and inability to arrive for mt first nights stay. They would not credit me for the first night upon arrival even though I did inform them in advance. My first stay at this hotel and I didn't realize it only had a three star rating. It should be reduced to two stars! I have camped outdoors and had more comfort. The Asian Hotel Booking service has not responded to several e-mails and this is my second time booking thru an Asian Travel Service and having a problem. I'll not do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Ashokrao
Reviews.Content: Date : 5th Dec 2008 Reviewer : N.B.Ashok I stayed with my family at this hotel from 17th to 20th of Oct 2008. I was looking for a hotel which had spacious rooms and close to MRT and city centre. I found Golden Landmark to be ideally located in central Singapore and close to Bugis MRT. It was walking distance from Little India, which helped us having affordable Indian food. (The Indian restaurant in the hotel was costly) The rooms were spacious and bathroom clean. The swimming pool on the fifth floor was neat. The hotel staff was quite helpful and all the talks from checkin to check out were carried out smoothly, without any worries. The best part was the travel desk managed by a private travel company called Luxury Tours. The lady was very helpful in planning our sightseeing. Overall a very good value for money hotel by Singapore standards.

Reviews.Title: “Good Honest Service at a Good Honest price”
Reviews.Author: acerockolla
Reviews.Content: In Singapore we stayed in The Golden Landmark Hotel (a Far East Hotel) which was on 390 Victoria Street, It seemed to be in the Arab area of town and was just 5 minutes walk from the MRT station - It\s a big place with a nice open air pool, the staff are very friendly and helpful and the rooms are probably a small step above the most basic. As the Far East Hotel connection might help explain this place is very popular with the Indian Market. I would not recommend using the in room wifi - it's expensive and slow and I had many problems!! They have a couple of free internet computers at the reception or better still go to the MRT and on the Purple (north) line they have wifi at the stations, it's fast, it's free and it's nice and cool down there! The surrounding areas have very good food options and with the MRT so easily accessible all of Singapore is just a short ride away. A TIP: When using the MRT get a A Singapore Tourist pass - it’s a daily ticket it looks expensive at 18 singapore dollars but its not 10 dollars of that are a deposit for the card - so compared with somewhere like London for instance, you can travel on a nice clean modern reliable train for less than the price of one trip on London's crappy so called integrated system. For the price the landmark offers no thrills comfort. - for those on a budget it works just fine. Bugis MRT and Bugis Village Mall are just five minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “What you pay for, you get!!”
Reviews.Author: nomad07
Reviews.Content: I was searching for an affordable hotel that had good reviews in Tripadvisor. This hotel appeared to be a good place to stay and by all accounts it was. It is in great area of Singapore, close to the Arab and Little India areas, so plenty of great eating spots, markets etc. Having just stayed at an up market hotel in Singapore, my expectations were realistic considering the price difference. When I arrived the hotle is clean, relatively tired, however they have everything you expect of a hotel. Reception was fast, however they booked me into a room with 2 single beds having requested a double on expedia. The room with the Single beds was below average with carpet that needed repair and a smell as though it had not been slepped in for some time. I was quickly moved to another room on level 15, which was great, with a King Bed. The room was clean, however nothing to get excited about, great for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oztrekker
Reviews.Content: Visited Singapore September 26-29 and booked Landmark because of an exceptional deal with Expedia. Needless to say, because of previous comments, was a bit wary but how wrong could you be? Perhaps the secret is to book the executive rooms because they certainly are spacious (you can upgrade on check in). The use of the executive lounge is a bonus with free drinks and nibbles. Breakfast is also served here and was a peaceful orderly event of an extremely high standard. The staff were marvellous - very friendly and helpful - can also endorse the review regarding bell boy desk - they were a laugh a minute and everybody loves British football!! The hotel is well positioned for MRT and all modes of transport and the taxis certainly are cheap. Singapore is a beautiful clean place and I would have no hesitation in staying at the Golden Landmark on a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Landmark in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: guideme
Reviews.Content: Location of the Golden Landmark hotel is excellent. It is near the shopping area for great bargains and the MRT is 2 blocks from the hotel. The room was spacious, clean and nice. What I got was the deluxe room and was really nice with big beds too. It was a real value for money. The hotel staff was helpful most specially the bellhop who help us when we had to store our luggage after we had checked out. They also helped us call a taxi for the airport. If you have time, the hotel also gives a free Heritage Tour via the hop on hop off bus for hotel guests, 2 persons per room FREE! I will always recommend the hotel to my friends, maybe their other properties in Singapore are just as good.

Reviews.Title: “rip-off”
Reviews.Author: EVA444
Reviews.Content: We were arriving at the airport around midnight and were in need of a place to stay, so we made a booking right at the airport hotel agency. We chose Golden Landmark because it seemed to be the best value hotel which turned out to be a big mistake. Once appeared there, we were briefed that we have to pay for the extra bed which we had not been told when booking and moreover 10 Euros accessorily because we booked at the airport. We got informed that we would get breakfast until 10:00h (actually it was until 10:30h) but the Receptionist didn’t mention that we will be charged for that seperately. When they presented the invoice we suddenly got aware that it was even worse: we had to pay tax in addition which - again – hadn’t been indicated before, and even cleaning the room was stated accounts in addition. It's not that we mind paying for services but we do mind if we get constantly surprised by things to pay that we hadn't been acquainted beforehand. The hotel rooms are average, room service was poor (we asked for 3 blankets but just got one). I have to grant a point in terms of luggage storage after checkout which worked perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - if you're single”
Reviews.Author: aycs
Reviews.Content: The Golden Landmark was the 3rd hotel we stayed at during our 19 night Singapore/KL holiday and although it was only a three night stay, it was probably the least enjoyable experience out of the three. We selected this hotel because it was very well located to the MRT station (5 minute walk), Bugis Junction and markets, and because it was reasonably priced. The entrance to the hotel was a bit of a treasure hunt because it was not located on either of the two main streets, but rather down the quiet side street. The foyer was also located upstairs on level 3, which we could reach by elevator or escalator. I should mention that even though the hotel has four elevators, it was still sometimes a long wait for a lift. It also didn't help that the doors only stay open for a very very short period of time, so if you are not quick enough to stick your hand in between the doors, or if no one is pressing the door open for you from the inside, it is very easy to miss your lift, something that happened to us and many other guests during our stay. Checking in did take quite a while, and after we were all assigned rooms, we found our four rooms close to each other and on the 11th floor. We requested rooms away from the elevators, but unfortunately found that one of our rooms was next to the lifts and my room was the next one over. So yes, we were woken up a few times during the night by noisy guests coming back early in the morning. One of the first things we noticed about our standard room was that the air-conditioner gauge was not working. Because the temperature was stuck at a degree that we felt was a bit uncomfortable, we eventually called someone to fix it, which he did (after we insisted twice), but from then we actually left the air-conditioner off because we found the temperature setting had only two settings - arctic and off... The room looked a little old, was modestly furnished with some of it looking a little worse for wear. Our room had a one particular table that I had placed my suit case apon, but after closer inspection, I removed it because I did not want to be billed for a broken table. What took the cake though, was the two small single beds for my wife and I. Our other travel companions consisted of another couple also suffered the same fate and although we didn't bother trying to ask for another room, I overheard three different conversations during our stay of the desk clerks apologising to guests that there were no double beds available. We thought about joining the beds together, but as there was a bedside table bolted to the wall, we decided it was just easier to have some 'alone time' from each other during our short stay. The room wasn't very big, but there was enough room to walk around without bumping into everything. It was also clean and quiet with very little noise from outside penetrating the window, except for one morning. We were there for the end of Ramadan and because the hotel is located next to a decent sized mosque, we were woken up very early one morning from their prayers, celebrating the end of Ramadan. The bathroom was pretty much standard and clean, although the towels weren't the best quality. Maybe a bit of fabric softener would have be helpful. The hotel is situated on top of a small three floor shopping centre, but the shops are mainly for the locals and besides a few souvenir shops, they consisted of goods and services that us tourists weren't interested in. When it came to shopping, Bugis Junction and Bugis markets was only 5 minutes away. We did not have breakfast at the hotel, but there was a food court across the road and again Bugis Junction (and Starbucks) just 5 minutes further down the road. Our rooms were cleaned whenever we left the sign out (which wasn't designed very well and would always fall off the door handle whenever you turned the handle), and check out again was a slow process, this time mainly due to waiting in line. The Golden Landmark is a very well located hotel, and although it served our purposes well by giving us a clean, somewhat comfortable room, in a great location and at a reasonable price, I found the staff a little distant, not very friendly, and not too interested in our concerns or requests.

Reviews.Title: “Give it and the attached SukMan Travel a miss...”
Reviews.Author: Wandering_Rick
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is old and in need of refurbishment. Its interior suggests days of glory but... The facilities are tired, with the 'gym' consisting of four cardio machines and the main bar better viewed in the dark. The pool does look good from a distance. The staff were average at best although when compared with the exceptional hospitality I experienced elsewhere in Singapore, they were found to be sadly lacking. Consistent with that thought, my one room service order was incorrect. The onsite travel agency Sukman is to be avoided. They endeavoured to charge me $280 for a service I ended up attending to for $70 and while I understand the need to make a profit, a 400% markup presents as somewhat excessive. Moreover, they lied in telling me all flights to Viet Nam were booked for the following three days. I should be clear that I'm uncertain Sukman has anything to do with the Golden Landmark apart from having entered into a tenancy agreement. That said, avoid them.

Reviews.Title: “A Landmark to MISS!”
Reviews.Author: oh_aaron
Reviews.Content: This is a place in which i would NOT RECOMMEND to anyone who's planning for a trip to Singapore. Golden Landmark is an older generation of hotels in which has a little shopping mall connected to it. I am ok with many hotels let it be old or new. one thing i do not appreciate is just bad level of service from the hotel. both my wife and i went to Singapore for a 4 day trip. book this place and we got an Executive Room (so called business suites). Upon check-in, i went to the room's toilet and found a 'resident' in the bathroom. i did take a picture of Mr.Roach too! (view the pictures below) my wife called the front desk and make a complain and asked to change rooms. about 15-20mins later a house keeping staff came and asked what was the matter. to me, didn't the front desk understood what we said? anyways she was here and told her about the roach, best part about it. she took one of the bath towels and stomped it to death before flushing it down the toilet. (perhaps i should have videoed the whole thingy?) as the house keeping staff did not understand what we said. i doubt she was local. we called frontdesk again, a good 20mins passed and after another call to the frontdesk then only someone came up to help us more to another floor. mind you we already have asked the duty manager to call us but nothing. getting into the room it looked ok until the night before bed. i found a hair on the complimentry soap dish with face towels. (also view the pictures below) after all this, still the duty manager did not call. later that night we spoke to another duty manager and she told us that he would call us back. eventually he did on the day just before we left, talk about efficiency of the staffs! rubbish! definately will not stay here ever again and will recommend others not to. my Singaporean friends and relatives also told me, after hearing my story that Golden Landmark hotel's service and quality has dropped tremendously. sadly they did not know i was going to stay there if not they'd tell me otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Not to bad, good location”
Reviews.Author: carlz01
Reviews.Content: We ended up upgrading to the executive floor (18) with breakfast etc. When we first walked in, we got hit by the smell of the aircon - smoke. I think we got used to it after that. The bathroom could be cleaner - mould in the grout etc and the towel are very cheap thin and small. The hotel is in a good location and close to the MRT - Bugis station. We enjoyed staying here for the few days and would probably stay again. Its just the little things that need to be fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Singapore Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: Auwaiku
Reviews.Content: Singapore hotels have gotten very pricey, but the Golden Landmark is a good value. It's within a short walking distance of the Bugis MRT, so transportation is convenient, too. They offer an upgrade to a club floor for $S30, which is worth it. I've stayed here before in regular rooms, but the club rooms have been refurbished and the extra charge gets you a nice breakfast in the club room, cocktails in the evening, high speed internet access (100 mbs) and a one-time suite pressing (very nice after a very long flight). The pool is nice. There's a small but adequate fitness center. All in all, a good deal, though not a fancy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable, but avoid the standard rooms”
Reviews.Author: TG119
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice, once at end of August and also in September. My first stay was in a deluxe room, which had recently been refurbished, and was very clean, although lighting seem to be somewhat dim. On my return stay, I was allocated the standard room that I had booked, which was well overdue for renovation, with stained carpets, scratched furniture and power points hanging off the walls. Location is good, with MRT a short walk away. I did not use the pool or other facilities during my stay so I cannot comment on these. Reception staff and room service was relatively quick and helpful. As a budget option, this hotel is okay, however I strongly suggest upgrading to a deluxe room, as the standard rooms are very old and shabby.

Reviews.Title: “golden landmark, please please avoid it !!!!”
Reviews.Author: mattforduk
Reviews.Content: we are on a 5 month trip of asia and have stayed at many places which we are putting on here for everyone to use etc if they need and by far the worst place we have stayed was the GOLDEN LANDMARK..... it started awfully and got worse and worse we specifically booked a double room non smoking on a high floor we ended up with a twin bed room that was smoking .... we called to get moved and the way we were dealt with was awful eventually we got moved after them telling us to try moving the beds together and spray deoderant to remove the smoke the room we were moved to was a double non smoking we checked in and crashe out on the bed .... went for a shower and the shower head fell out the wall !!!!! i then discovered filthy dirty womesn underwear left in the wardrobe from a previous occupant.... it took 25mins on the phone to reception for a manger to come and sort out... further 25mins and we were moved to a pretty nice suite on 16th floor the whole saga was an absoloute nightmare .... i really do advise you not to stay there !!!!!!!!!!!!!! go to other hotels in area i wish we had !!

Reviews.Title: “A great stop-over hotel”
Reviews.Author: nlbm
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was a pleasant experience after reading some of the reviews on here. The reception staff were generally helpful, but did forget to do things a few times when we asked - room took a while to get ready, an item from laundry took a number of phone calls before it arrived. Situated in a good location about 200m from Bugis Junction and MRT station. The pool area was great after a humid day sightseeing and was clean with towels provided. The rooms were large and clean with very comfy beds. Would recommend this hotel for a short stop-over. Note if you book through Hotels.com for a room to accommodate children, the hotel expect the child to sleep in your bed no matter how old they are. It was only after some heated discussion with reception that they agreed not to charge us for a fold-a-way bed.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel! Value for money!!”
Reviews.Author: Ramkishore
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel for 3 days, loved the the view from our 19th floor room. didnt have any trouble during our stay here except for a constant noise from the roof that sounded like an airplane flap deploying and retracting every 20 mins, dont have a clue what was making this noise but it sounded loud enough to bother guests staying on the floors close to the terrace! had a very difficult time trying to sleeping and eventually had to use earbuds!! that apart, the hotel is good and clean, value for money!! will stay here again but probably not on the 19th floor! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Big Rip Off !!”
Reviews.Author: Nidhi80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Landmark during a short weekend break in Singapore this Aug. The booking was done through their reservations desk via the website - which we thought was smart on our part but little did we know ! The bad parts ? - - The reservations did not tell us about an additional tax ( on top of the regular 17%) which was applicable on every night basis - The room was badly maintained - housekeeping did not clean the bathroom on a SINGLE day of the 3 days we spent there, nor were the so called 'complimentary' tea & coffee sachets replaced.My sister ordered room service on the first night, the tray was not cleared till the next day evening...and that too only when we called and complained ! - The breakfast was a crime, for the 15SGD you pay for it...and ofcourse, u pay a service charge on that as well ! Actually, there is a service charge on everything, do keep in mind... - On checking out, our bill included an amount for two telephone calls made from our room...during a time we were not even in the hotel ! Had to spend 20mins telling them why we wouldnt pay for it...before they agreed to strike it off.. The good parts ? Not enough for me to make points...the location near the MRT I guess ( though we never got around to using it) - though taxis can be quite difficult to get near the entrance...it's a one way street, and most cab drivers did not want to get in...so would drop us off some distance away.. Summary - You can get a 100 times better experience in other hotels which cost marginally more...so dont waste your money - unless you dont really mind dirty bathrooms :)

Reviews.Title: “No nonsense hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chinmay
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and the basic advantage we received is the good location near Bugis MRT. We just moved around singapore in only MRT and buses,which was very cheap for us.This hotel is known as "Indian tourist hub" and more than 50 % of rooms were booked by Indians as the hotel has a Indian restaurent on 5th floor.There is also a good Indian restaurent across the road. The hotel Air conditioning was very cold and though we tried to control it through temperature setting dial,it did not work.We both had sinus trouble due to the cold AC. Also we had a small argument with hotel staff while settling the telephone bill.We have bought the Airtel world calling card in India,and when we used this card to call India from hotel room,we were charged at international rates though we did not use hotel's international line. But finally we managed to settle the bill. Use pay phones at the ground floor for making International calls and buy calling cards for cheap IDD calling. Use the strategic location of this hotel to travel by MRT and save some money in taxi fares.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay”
Reviews.Author: lanzrenell
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and near to shopping centers. My children enjoyed the pool. The breakfast in the poolside was fantastic. I booked for a double room, but the hotel gave us a triple room without extra charges. Our room was really spotless with complete toiletries. The view from our room was fantastic overlooking the big mosque.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: arvburg
Reviews.Content: This hotel has had abit of a makeover in the rooms department and so we were more than happy with it for our sort stay.The Location is terriffic so close to mrt, bus and bugis junction and shops

Reviews.Title: “View was good”
Reviews.Author: relic1964
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Golden Landmark from 12 June and departed on 18 June. The hotel is very convienient to Bugis Markets and is central to most things. Reception staff were ok but I do suggest you keep a list of all calls made and meals booked through room service and make sure you check your bill on departure so you don't pay for things that you have already paid for. Mooi Chin Restaurant was pretty good for meals and The Riverwalk Tandoor was also good. Room was clean but the room smelt of smoke from smoking. 2 bottles of complimentary water are left daily so do use them. If I were to go back to Singapore I would give Golden Landmark a miss and try another place. My room was on the 11th floor

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: lauzieMelbourne
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night in April, then returned in May for 4 nights. The first time I stayed I could not fault the hotel, but on returning we had problems with them putting us in the wrong room, then moving us to a room that was dirty and unclean. They then gave us a choice of 4 rooms to pick from, which in time took over an hour to resolve. My disapointment was that they were not appologetic and did not offer any sort of compensation to us, which would have been appreciated. I also was not happy on our last day, as we had arranged a late check out, but were walked in on by the hotel staff at 7.30am of that morning, much to our embarrassment. We then recieved a few phone calls and hang ups which really got me angry, but again no apology was offered. The location of the hotel is excellent, but I would look at alternative hotels for my next visit to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: 50countries
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 4 days in February. We travel a lot and we found the hotel to be exceptional value for money in Singapore. We never had any problems with room cleanliness or service. We chose an executive level room and the extra cost was well worth it for the room, internet access, free drinks (soft and alcoholic) plus breakfast and snacks in the evening. All of the staff were friendly and helpful and the location was ideal for exploring Kampong Glam and Little India. The close proximity of the MRT station also made it easy to get to more distant locations. Overall a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel for decent price”
Reviews.Author: australianirl
Reviews.Content: The Golden Landmark has nice spacious rooms with nice views. The room we stayed in was a twin and there was lots of room for all our luggage. It has a desk, mini fridge, and chair. The bathroom was really dimly lit but this didn't prove to cause any problems at all. The location isn't particularly ideal for shopping on Orchard Rd unless you catch a cab or bus.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near the city”
Reviews.Author: Prema_C
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a day in Golden Landmark hotel. We found the hotel worthy of the tariff we paid. The room was very spacious and well maintained. The view from the 18th floor was good. The club facility gave us access to coffee, breakfast and internet. As our flight was in the evening, we needed a late check out and the staff was very helpful. Overall a good experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fallen standards, but still decent.”
Reviews.Author: brave1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel several times, and it used to be an excellent value for money hotel. This year, I noticed the standards had dropped a bit, there were cobwebs on the ceilings, the bathroom tiles were chipped, the room amenities much less than what they used to be. However, it still is a good hotel for the money. You will probably not have any nasty surprises. But be careful of their online booking system. I booked for a bed & breakfast rate, but when the booking was done I re-checked with the hotel and they said breakfast was not included. Considering breakfast is SGD 15 pp, we decided to skip breakfast at the hotel and eat outside. There are plenty of eating options outside with a nice bakery/coffee shop at Raffles hospital complex just opposite, and Bugis Village is just a 5 min walk away. The location is great, central, and 5 min from Bugis MRT station. The hotel is renovating some of the rooms, so if they can work their way back to their original standards, I will be staying in this hotel again. All in all, not a bad choice if you don't want to spend too much.

Reviews.Title: “No dont waste money here”
Reviews.Author: Musu
Reviews.Content: Please do not go over here. The hotel furniture is very old. Bathroom very small. Small insects all over the furniture. The location is fine but besides that there is nothing in this hotel. Go on and surf for a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: travelingtheworldnow
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed at this hotel. The rooms are horrible and the carpet is dirty and very updated. We talked to the hotel manager within 15 minutes after we arrived to our room about the poor quality of the room which the nice guy immediately upgraded us to another room which was just as bad as the first room..that morning we were awoke to 5 men in the hall renovating the hallway floor and was told that we needed to keep our door open so they could replace the carpet in the hallway. The replacement carpet was cheap and out dated just as the old carpet but the new carpet didn't have any stains. That morning my family and I decided that if we are going to enjoy our vacation we must check out of this hotel ....so we moved to another place which was much better. I warn you don't be fool by the pictures...because this hotel is horrible...However, I must say that the staff here is very very nice and the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic”
Reviews.Author: bellecooper
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many hotels in asia and this hotel is a very typical "asian" style hotel. It is very very average and nothing spectacular. The key selling point is the location is very good. The hotel is very basic and you get what you pay for. The front desk was very nice to us and checked us in before 2pm which was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: amadl
Reviews.Content: We booked for a triple room with king-sized bed, but was given a double with twin beds instead. Room size was ok. Service were slow and sometimes the staffs were rude. The best feature: Location.

Reviews.Title: “not worth it”
Reviews.Author: stowboy
Reviews.Content: This is a dingy place and you could do much better for the money. My room was ok but only just... I was offered 6pm check out by Expedia (subject to availability) if I upgraded. I did. On arrival I was told 2pm was the best they could do. I asked if the hotel was fully booked, I was told it was... Really?? Not giving up I asked what would happen if I rang the hotel and asked to book a room... Eventually the receptionist conceeded that the hotel wasn't fully booked, so there was availability, so i could stay to 6pm. I realise this is all very dull but that's the point. I can't be bothered with that kind of c**p in this day and age. The pool is okay. The gym is small. The location is the hotel's only redeeming feature. Near Little India, Arab Street and Bugis Street. Don't stay here. Spend your money somewhere else

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel for the money!!”
Reviews.Author: ooresutthu
Reviews.Content: Booked through Ratestogo.com. We arrived 5 hours before check in time, the room wasnt available, but at executive one was available. So we upgraded.. and it was indeed a gud decision. The room was quite spacious, pretty decent breakfast, the executive lounge had drinks and munchies all round the day which was useful. It is near a metro station... but we found taxis comfortable and reasonbly priced... so we mostly used taxi or walked. The bed was comfortable.. and bathroom very clean and nice. Will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ACChua
Reviews.Content: The Golden Landmark is a hotel located a bit off from the main commercial area in Orchard Road but is within walking distance to Arab Street and Bugis. Stayed here for two nights in late-2006. Check-in wasn't too good. It took a while and the staff handling reception was a bit rude. The room itself is average. It comes with standard amenities such as a toiletry kit, slippers, etc. It's quite obvious that they had some refurbishing done in the rooms so the furniture at least got a new coat of paint, though it could use some more refinement. The room was also a bit dark and during our second night the bathroom light did not work properly. There was a breakfast buffet but the selection was not that great compared to other hotels I've stayed in. Overall, I probably wouldn't stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Rude and Horrible staff.”
Reviews.Author: ANIRMITR2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at GL two weeks back. Wonderful location ; BUGIS MRT within 2 minutes walk. Rooms are decent enough and clean. The worst part is the management. All the staffs are extremely rude and have no concern for the guests. Although we booked way in advance, we were made to wait for almost 2 hours and they offered the same excuse to other waiting guests " Room not ready". We had booked a triple room but they made arrangements for the third bed in another 2 hours. When asked about it, all they had to say : " You booked through travel agent and not through us". What a horrible excuse. Avoid this hotel also because its overcrowded. The reception is very noisy and they are least bothered. Its only the location for which they are cashing in .....

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL STAY”
Reviews.Author: aditiDelhi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 days..we were 3 families.the rooms,washroom were clean..pool was of good size and the kids had a wonderful time in the pool..it was spotlessly clean..breakfast and dinner had a lavish spread and we indeed freaked out...The location was fantastic..its in the heart of the city..My husband and I would walk in the park at 12 am..Singapore is a very very safe place..was amazed to find girls,women all walking alone at night..in all a lovely stay...

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Golden Landmark.”
Reviews.Author: Gushead
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from an extremely unacceptable 3 night stay at the Golden Landmark Hotel, Singapore booked through the hotels.com website. On arrival we were warned that there was "refurbishment work" taking place on the upper floors, and there would possibly be some noise during the hours of 0900-1800. The hotels.com website states "Renovation Notice. The Executive Club rooms will be undergoing renovations until the end of April 2006." We had booked and paid for a renovated Executive Club room on the upper floors for comfort and relaxation. On entering the room we were welcomed by loud building work noise. This wasn't background noise, it was loud and very close -one floor below I believe. As we had just flown long haul from London we were hoping to rest, but the noise made this totally impossible. We immediately asked Reception for a room change and/or a refund but were told that only non-renovated standard rooms were available on the lower floors and no refund could be offered as the booking was made via hotels.com. We asked the Duty Manager why the hotel offered "executive club" rooms to well paying guests, knowing that building work was taking place in close proximity. His only reply was that a lot of guests are sightseeing or out on business during the day. This is obviously not the case for people who are on holiday, have just arrived exhausted after a long haul flight, and are hoping to rest in a quiet and comfortable room during the heat of the day! When pushed, the Duty Manager offered us an alternative "day room" for use during the day only. Each morning at 0900, tired after being woken by the noise, we had to present ourselves at reception to collect the key and return it again in the evening. The day room was uncomfortable, unclean and stank of cigarette smoke - it was barely used. Our stopover in Singapore was supposed to be a stress free and relaxing holiday, and also incorporated a birthday celebration. The situation at the Golden Landmark completely ruined the experience for us both. When a formal complaint was made to hotels.com they offered us a small refund that did not even equate to one nights stay. We advise travellers to avoid the Golden Landmark and the hotels.com website.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, 3-star comfort”
Reviews.Author: steakandalepie
Reviews.Content: The location can't be faulted - just 5mins walk from Bugis MRT, and the area's vibrant night market. Check-in for our internet booked room was quick and business-like. The room was what we expected for the price . It was comfortable and fairly large, with decent attached bathroom, but lacking in any kind of modern style or frills. We found the centrally controlled air-con freezing. The swimming pool is a good size, and there is a nice little outdoor terrace by the pool for drinks. Overall, a safe bet, but look elsewhere for a luxury/treat hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, Bad stuff, Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Longhorn123
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Golden Landmark for 2 nights on our way back from Bali. Paid around USD140 including taxes for a deluxe room w/o bfast. I asked about late check out during check in and paid extra SGD40 for 4pm check-out. We got a 19th floor corner room, which was tiny and dark thanks to a very small window. The stuff could not care less. No smile or greetings whatsoever. The concierge refused to call a cab for us saying that it would take longer to get one by calling. He rather advised us to just wait outside the entrance. At that point, I called a cab from the pay phone in the lobby and the cab shows up in 5 minutes!!!! But the location was great and very convenient. It is only 5 min walk to MRT and also close to shopping places like Bugis street and Sim Lim square. I think the only plus point of this hotel is the location. Stay away if you can!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice But Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: AnAussieInLondon
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via Lastminute and our stay was okay but nothing special. Our check in took a long time and the staff didn't seem particularly friendly. The room was fine - a bit older but everything worked. They are currently refurbishing rooms though. The room had a lovely view. The staff member who brought up our bags helped find an extra blanket which was nice. Our check out took quite a while and there didn't seem to be any order as to who was being dealt with first. Apart from the experience at the front desk the hotel offered fairly good value.

Reviews.Title: “Depressing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stephen_Lloyd
Reviews.Content: Passing through Singapore essentially in transit (arrive 3pm, leave 8am the day after) we went for a value for money hotel. I got cheap I suppose, but not value. Following the advice of earlier reviews on here we booked the executive floor for the better rooms and obvious evening drinks. The room was small, dark (one small window in the corner) with a light brown/tobacco paint on the walls, similar net curtains and the plesant sound of pneumatic drills till 7pm. This after being ignored at the Club floor check in area by the regular counter staff untill they told us "it's not working there". Eventually went into the fridge, or the excutive club room, where people wrapped themselves to keep warm! A very limited food (cheese and ham slices, one bowl local dish) and more limited drinks , the same depressing colour scheme had me wishing for the early dpearture. I know it is being refreshed so I dread to think how tired the hotel was beforehand. By Singapore standards this was awful. The star was the only staff member dealing with the club lounge, who tried her best but was doing it with her hands effectively tied behind her back. I doubt she'll be ther long as no doubt will move on to a better hotel. It's cheap, but not value, strictly for those who enjoy being depressed.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: apedog
Reviews.Content: Although it has a great location the hotel may have the most uncomfortable beds ever created. For the price...even booking on a hotels website with a reduced rate...i felt i was cheated. If I could go back, I would definitely spent the little bit extra and had a more relaxing experience elsewhere. If ammenities, personalized service, and comfort are in any way important to you...then skip it. I personally was travelling as a backpacker, plushing it up for a few days...and had a much more rewarding experience at my hostel, for 80% less of a price.

Reviews.Title: “Good place....”
Reviews.Author: ramlal
Reviews.Content: The reivews i had read here scared me after my travel agent told me he is booking me into the Golden landmark... Naah...it wasnt like that...it was much better than i expected...no dirty carpets, no waiting to check in , no bags to carry on my own...has a taxi stop in the drive way...good resturants (indian and muslim too) just opposite...a seven 11 also nearby...what else does one want? Internet pay 10 SING dollars for a hour or walk 5 mins to raffles hospital accross the road and sit in starbucks... nice swimming pool...not too deep for the kids too at 1.1 m....indian and other food within the resturant... no major dissapointments...

Reviews.Title: “Tired and average hotel”
Reviews.Author: malolava
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed with the quality of this hotel as compared with the price. Check in was perfunctory and there was no one to help with my very heavy bag, and questions were met with minimal assistance. The room itself was tired and felt grotty - carpets were stained and looked old. The room service was pretty good, and the pool was quite nice too. I wouldnt stay here again - i think you can get better deals for more upmarket hotels in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Service”
Reviews.Author: Paul_Varjack
Reviews.Content: I received bad reveiws about this pace from the cab driver who took me to the hotel from the airport when i arrived in singapore and from a different cabbie on my way back. Rooms are not bad, but the service is awful. The receptionists were argumentative and the ppl stationed at the door were unwilling to help catch a taxi or load/unload luggage. The TV had 20 channels in all and only 3 of them were in English. There are several other good 3 star hotels in Singapore. Try any except this one.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: Waterrecycle
Reviews.Content: While waiting to checkin (took about 30 minutes!) I asked a guy who was checking out about the hotel. he said it was average and suggested I pay the extra for an executive floor room. Im glad I did - the room was quite good. The only negative was that it had a very strong antiseptic smell. The club room was good - drinks and nibblies available all day and free internet. Staff were friendly and the breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Could be much better”
Reviews.Author: SiZ
Reviews.Content: We checked in at around 2:30PM and was told to wait for some minutes while the receptionist double checked if the hotel room had been cleaned. So we waited for 15 min (we sat on a couch just in front of the front desk), and didn't get any update on the room. We came back to the receptionist and then she told us that the room was ready, gave us 2 key cards, and even told us that there could be a room manager still doing some "finishing touch" in the room. To our surprise, the room door was open and the room was still dirty. We then left our luggages inside the room, lock the door, and reported the matter to the help desk (Ms. Nora). She came upstairs with us and found a cleaning service woman and told her to clean our room asap. We thought the problem was solved. But the second day when we returned to the hotel in the middle of the day to drop some shopping bags, we found our room door open, even when it looked like the room has been cleaned by room service, and no cleaner was in sight. We thought it was harmless. However, when we checked out and got the bill, we were charged for an international phone call that we never made! It looks like someone came inside our room and made the call easily since the door was left open! Maybe we could even say we were lucky that none of our belongings was stolen. It was really the worst experience we've ever had in a 4-star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in good location near many of Singapore's ethnic districts!”
Reviews.Author: dctrips
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Landmark for 4 nights while in Singapore on vacation and opted to spend just a little more extra (5 USD) per night for a room on the Executive Floor. We didn't see the rooms on the other floors, but my guess is that they were the same size - it's just that the Executive Floor rooms were recently refurbished (tastefully so) and you get free wireless internet and access to the Executive Lounge for free served continental (and more) breakfast, snacks in the afternoon and alcohol in the evening... as well as a few other goodies. We highly recommend the Executive Floor. Overall, the hotel's not much to look at from the outside with the Golden Landmark shopping center, but really beautiful on the inside with excellent service and a lovely indoor koi pond. The location is great - a block from Arab Street and within 5-10 minute walking distance to a variety of diverse districts (Little India, Chinatown) and 3-minute walk to the very clean and efficient MRT metro line at Bugis Street. Bugis is also great for a large outdoor market where you can find all kinds of great things and fascinating cool drinks to quench your thirst on those hot Singapore days. This hotel serves as a terrific base. Taxis are aplenty - just wait for one outside the lobby and it's very cheap to get to any major attraction in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore on the way home”
Reviews.Author: helix77
Reviews.Content: We came to the hotel from Malaysia. The check-in was ok and we were ok with the room facing the pool. The breakfirst was ok. After a day in the city we came back to find that no bathtowels were to find. I called the frontdesk and said "We did get any towels, can you please bring us towels" The lady at front desk sounded very tired and not friendly at all. After 15min, the doorbell rang, I opened the door. Outside is a man from the hotel staff not looking happy and the gives me the towels and walk away with out a word. I then realised that they have just given us one towel, so i call again. Aftert five minutes someone is banging on the door, very angy. The same man with an angry look and it feels like that we should be happy that they answered the call at all. Beside from that the hotel is ok. In their internet kiosk they don't have a printer and it coats 5 singspore dollar to use for an hour. In the same building there is a little store that sells drinks, candy and other stuff. There is coats for internet 2 singapore dollar an hour. The hotel is on subway line from the airport and it's not heavy to bring your stuff to and from the airport. The nearest station is only five minutes away. Would I stay at that hotel again ? No, I would pay a little more extra for better service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Matcham16
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in a great location, views were beautiful. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: crystaldolphin59
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 nights stopover In Singapore. I picked this hotel because of its location to areas I had not visited worked out to be wonderful, Bugis street Markets everything you need and large shopping malls, our other favourite place Sim Lim Square within walking distance. As for the hotel checkin was swift shown to our room promply the only thing was we had two king single beds they had not put them together and I did complain. We Stayed on the executive floor 18 with drinks and breakfast included, room was big enough good views great blockout on window curtains. Staff in executive room were just wonderful and very helpful and patient. Pool area has recently been renovated and looked very nice. We would definetly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MattyMate
Reviews.Content: This was a nice looking hotel with beautiful chandalier in the lobby. Desk staff were pleasant enough. Hotel tour agent was very helpful and personally escorted us to the hop-on/hop-off bus so that we could travel cheaply around the city. Nice rooms with TV and minibar. Enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Golden Landmark Hotel”
Reviews.Author: femaleTurista
Reviews.Content: at first i was kinda worried coz we will not be staying in the shopping district of orchard road coz during that time (May 2007) the orchard hotels were fully booked. but Fortunately, we chose this hotel coz it has the Best location. it's a mere 5 minute walk to mrt (bugis station), bus stop, walking distance to affordable shopping malls (bhg, og, etc.), street market (bugis street- this is the BEST for bargin hunters like me), sim lim square, veeery nice old style shophouses, sultan mosque, restaurants, money changers, virtually everything!!! the reception staff were accomodating upon check in and check out. no problem. the rooms were in good condition nothing 5star but definitely worth every penny (except that we were not provided with bath robes). toilet flush, shower, sink, aircon working very well. buffet breakfast was around S$12 each person and was okay. we expected what foods we will see and enjoyed it. anyway, we were not there for a breakfast festival or something. it was more than enough to fill our stomachs for the morning's adventures. sample foods for breakfast were: veggie rice, breads, jam, cereals, ham, egg, sausage, corned beef, fried spring rolls, samosas, pork & beans, bacon (not crunchy! huhuhu), chicken n veggie curries, fresh fruits, milk, coffee, tea, fruit juices. those were what i remember. only setback was that there was no complimentary local calls (charged S$0.10 just like in pay phones). one more nice about this hotel is it's just across raffles hospital. but it was never noisy nor crowded in the street. i would definitely stay here again and would definitely recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Earth
Reviews.Content: Check in Experience - Excellent. We arrived at the hotel at about 7:30am after a sleepless flight from Australia. We were worried about not being able to access our booked room until 2:00pm; without us even asking, the very polite lady at check-in told us that a room was available to us immediately. Yay! She also said we could use the free breakfast facilities (see below) that I didn't expect would be available to us until the next morning (our first "official" morning). The room was also a pleasant surprise. We upgraded to the "Executive" floors when booking. This entitled us to a renovated room; access to the Executive Lounge on the 18th floor at any time, which included free Internet, free continental breakfast, and free cocktails from 6 - 8pm each evening. The service from the staff in the Executive Lounge has been excellent. The room itself is on the small side of hotel rooms, but is clean, and recently renovated. The bed is very comfortable, and HUGE. Curtains are thick and block out the sun. Room service each day has been excellent, including some free snacks they left one day in the middle of our stay. We were worried initially about the location of the hotel, as we drove through the old shophouses of Arab Street in the cab on the way from the airport. But in fact, the location has been excellent. Bugis MRT is one block (a hospital!) away, and the transport in Singapore has proved to be excellent as promised. There are several restaurants nearby. Arab Street and all of its silk shops are literally on the next block. Cabs are cheap. There is also a major shopping centre at Bugis. We have a midnight flight out of Singapore tomorrow, and the hotel has extended our checkout time to 2pm. If we want to stay until 6pm, it will cost us only $60. At 6pm, we can then come to the Executive Lounge and have free cocktails until we need to leave for the airport! We found that the Golden Landmark is great value for money (you sacrifice staying in one of the trendier locations, such as Orchard Road, for a nice room at a cheaper rate; however, the location and price of the MRT makes that all fine, and everywhere is accessible and close) and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Geat Stopover choice - try the Exec Floor upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Cleo_O
Reviews.Content: Whilst travelling to Australia from London we wanted somwhere to break that long, arduous flight, without breaking the bank, so spotted the Golden Landmark on TA. We opted for a room on the Exec Floor - only £9 more than a standard room - and got lots of little added extras, such as late check-out, so we could use the pleasant roof top pool, free internet usage in the Exec Club Lounge (and free snacks and coffee there too). The location is excellent being only minutes walk to a subway station and a short stroll to the Arab Quarter for a meal out under the stars and walking distance to Orchard Road. The bathroom was on the snug side, but the rooms were spacious and clean and the bed very comfortable. After a good night's sleep in Singapore, nice dinner and refreshing swim we got to Melbourne feeling refreshed.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended for a Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: cmrv
Reviews.Content: Definitely a good location for Gadget shoppers coz it's very near Sim Lim. We stayed only for overnight but the $$ paid is kinda worth it. My only disappointment were those stains on the toilet that cannot be removed but it's tolerable for a short stay. I can't comment on the food coz we didn't avail the breakfast. If we go back to Singapore soon, might consider going back to that hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “There are better hotels to stay”
Reviews.Author: Pipilota
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 2 nights March 5th - 7th March 2007. The hotel is old and so are the rooms. It was clean and quiet but the bed linen were broken in some places. Reception was OK. Breakfast wasn´t good-the same food in both mornings and some things were finished at 8:30 am and many people. There were lots of Indian people in this hotel. We would better stay in another hotel next time. Monika & René

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: lexthen
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at this hotel. The hotel lobby is situated inside an old shopping mall (Golden Landmark Building). For SD167 (including tax, etc) it is a little bit expensive for budget travelers. They have screwed up our reservations for non-smoking room even though I have personally called the hotel desk for reservation, confirming a non-smoking room. We insisted we be compensated, so they gave us a better room at the top floor (smoking room but found out there were no foul smelling cigarrette smell, luckily). Desk service seems slow, need to improve on their efficiency to be able to cope with simultaneous check-ins during peak hours. Otherwise, room is spacious (twin beds at level 19, smoking), and 3 mins walk to Bugis MRT station, 3 mins walk to Bugis Junction, Bugis street markets. Don't hesitate to ask for compensation if rooms are unsatisfactory (saw lots of bad reviews from various hotel booking websites). We're not planning to stay at this hotel if we plan to go to Spore next time. Day trip is good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Well we liked it!”
Reviews.Author: Bwucey
Reviews.Content: The first time we stayed in Singapore we stayed at another hotel further away and gor tired of the 15 minute walk to the MRT, We spoted the Golden Landmark and decided to stay there next time because of its good location to shops and transport. We enjoyed it very much. The hotel is quite basic compared to other asian hotels but the room was clean, the service was quick friendly and excellent. Our TV wasnt working and a repair man was sent up 5 minutes after calling reception. We have stayed there twice now and are going again in May 2007. Singapore as a tourist is an amazing place. I feel its illogical to pay top dollar for a hotel where you only sleep and shower. The most important aspects for me are location and as long as the hotel is clean and secure then I am happy. I really feel the Golden landmark fits the bill nicely. The other advantage is, when you get lost, simply look up, find the big sign that says Raffles Hospital, and head that way as the hotel is right next door! Next time we have breakfast included, which we havent had before, but it was free so we were not going to turn it down. I will review breakfast when we get back.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: BabeXmas
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel. I've stayed here 3 times already and are going back in just a couple of days. I have always been treated in a friendly and polite way. I don't spend my holidays chatting with the staff - but they are always there if I need tany service. The hotel is very close to Bugis Junction, the shops, metro and restaurants. It's clean, fresh and has been a good value for money. If you're only here for a couple of days - I will strongly recomend it. For a week or perhaps longer - try to find a more secluded and smaller hotel that cares for you as a friend - not a customer. The hotels breakfast buffé is the only thing I don't like. But there is a great bakery just a few blocks down close to the hospital.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Value - Don't know why other reviewers didn't like it !”
Reviews.Author: travellerdna
Reviews.Content: This review is quite delayed because I stayed here in Aug 2005. I was recently researching hotels on Tripadvisor for my Dec 2006 trip to Singapore and I came across many bad reviews for this hotel which surprised me considering my past stay there. I'm not sure if I have low standards or low expectations compared to other guests in this hotel but I've found the Golden Landmark to be a good hotel and good value for money. The rooms were clean, the sheets are not torn, towels were clean and basic toileteries were provided. The lifts are busy because its a busy hotel but they were clean and all were operational. The reception staff were professional and polite - not friendly or chatty. When we arrived they did their job, flashed the usual smiles and moved on to the next guest. That left us no time to judge their friendliness or indulge in touristy chitchat - but the staff were certainly NOT rude in any manner. Golden Landmark was most certainly good when I stayed there in Aug '05. If you want to experience what "bad" means then you gotta stay in Aspinals Hotel in Little India - I did that in Dec '06 and realized how good Golden Landmark was. For Indians this hotel has a surprise - it has an inhouse Indian restaurant which serves buffet and regular Indian food. We used to dine here regularly and the food was always decent. Breaskfast was included in our package and was well laid out with choice of juices, cerealls, fresh fruits, tea and coffee etc. The location of hotel is nice for shopping in Bugis Junction and Bugis village. The Bugis MRT is below the Bugis junction and its a short 5-7 min walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A really really bad hotel.”
Reviews.Author: traveller365
Reviews.Content: Really bad hotel.Terrible front desk staff,rude and indifferent attitude. We checked in much after our scheduled check in time but our room was not ready so had to wait 45 minutes for our room. Room itself was ok.nothing extraordinary,but the window had so many oil stains and hand prints,which gave the room a rather untidy look, Breakfast was a battle with hordes and hordes of budget travellers converging upon the food,of which there was not enough of. Lack of crockery and cutlery and even food forced us to start eating breakfast out. Check out took a really long time... Location not so great,a 15 minute walk to Bugis street junction station,which can be tiring on a long day. If you have a choice,dont stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Disguistingly DIRTY !!!”
Reviews.Author: Cheeky_Cockerel
Reviews.Content: Pro: Great location Cons: Disguistingly DIRTY and more...!!! Mouldy bathroom, mouldy shower curtain that reeked of urine, scrapping paintwork... you feel dirty even after a shower! No hot water in the shower, which I had to ring to get fixed. They allow people to smoke in the corridors and without any sort of ventilation makes the corridor stink of corridor smoke which permeated into our room (supposedly a smoke free room which we had to pay extra for!!) Service is very slow. Whenever we ring for service, it takes a long time firstly for someone to pick up the phone, then for someone to see to our request. Location is great at Bugis BUT it is also next to a mosque, which means you hear their daily prayer chants. This is especially annoying for light sleepers when you hear it at dawn. A word of warning for safety.. the lift doors have no sensors and close very quickly. Be wary when pushing a pram through!! To sum, this is NOT a golden experience. Avoid, avoid, AVOID!!!

HotelInfo.Name: Landmark Village Hotel by Far East Hospitality
HotelInfo.Address: 390 Victoria Street, Singapore 188061, Singapore (Formerly Golden Landmark Hotel)
